text: This is my first yelp review but felt I had to say something. We were excited to come here for the end of the week happy hour and to get ready for the weekend but were surprised how bland the food was.  It was obvious that they did not use fresh ingredients.  We ordered a few items that were served within two minutes, which leads us to believe that is pre-made and either sitting under a heat lamp or microwaved for quick delivery.  The food came quickly and was really hot for about 45-60 seconds on the surface but cool on the inside. We ordered the stuffed artichokes that were rubbery (squeaked as you chewed), mac and cheese was ok and the tortilla a la espanola had no flavor, not even the "spicy" sauce that comes with it and the last thing you would want is lukewarm eggs and potatoes. Finally, we got the chicken picatta. This was the last one to come out so they probably cooked this one. The sauce and potatoes that comes with it were good. Chicken was ok, basically a pounded out chicken breast. Maybe they don't make their food for happy hour and just reuse leftovers. The food was bland, nothing like real tapas or true Barcelona flavor. The service was ok, nothing horrible but nothing great - didn't feel really welcomed but not neglected either.  After reading the reviews I was expecting something great and was completely disappointed. I will not be gong back and would not recommend this restaurant.

They are very friendly and have great service every time I have been been in to dine. They have always taken care of anything quickly if the order was wrong.
The food is delicious. The all you can eat is a great deal and the pitchers of sangria are yummy.

Love love love! I would fly into Vegas JUST to eat here! I am also one of the ladies in the video when you had Yelp there reviewing the place! I was the new customer blown away! Keep up the fantastic work, I always recommend anyone who is visiting Las Vegas to go here!

Oh my gosh fabulous!  Croquetas, salad , expanadas and chicken picatta with to die for mashed potatoes.  My husband and I shared on the happy hour - fantastic!!!  Great bread platter with humus , warm and seasoned butter a great surprise.   Great place check it out!
Food was OK, not well paired. Overpriced for the amount you get. Will not be coming back.

Have eaten here three times in two weeks!  Can't get enough of their mojitos, mac and cheese, fish tacos, fresh French fries, empanadas, and bacon-wrapped dates!  Icing on the cake is wait staff with smiles, clean and hip surroundings, fast service, and plenty of parking.  Kudos, Barcelona!  We'll definitely be back.

We have never had tapas before, so we decided to try this place.  We ordered fried goat cheese balls, calamari, chorizo stuffed mushrooms, lamb sausage with quinoa, and fried lamb chops with quinoa.  Everything was delicious.  My only complaint would be that the lamb chops were tiny.  They were about one bite each ( you get two).  For $11, I think I should get more than 2 bites.
Excellent tapas and great service!!  The tapas were wonderful and flavorful, I highly recommend the "All you can eat menu", and our server was very friendly and had great recommendations.
Attentive service, great happy hour prices , and great tasting food. Blood Orange mojitos are a must try!

Cute place, food is very similar to firefly (without the salmonella). Sorry but I was a huge fan of firefly, and this place has identical dishes. Of course I tried their sangria as well and it was really flavorful and strong. I loved it. Also went here for a happy hour and they have a good variety for drinks and food specials ranging between $2-3 for some dishes. The staff is slow to come to the table, but if you sit closer to the bar it seemed faster.

One of my absolutely favorite places in the city to take people!  Happy hour is extremely generous, food is Firefly-ish but 10 times better and the people are not as pretentious, though it is not unusual to see nothing but bmw/mercedes in the parking lot.  The experience is very comfortable, the owner works nearly 7 days a week to make sure that his baby is a pleasure to come and relax in.  I would say it's a lot like a lounge with MUCH better food!  And I'm sorry to all the band-wagon people out there, but BARCELONA MAKES BETTER SANGRIA THAN FIREFLY HAHAHAHAHA!!!! Oh YES I did!

I've been here a handful of times over the years and again I remember why I don't frequent this place often.  Service staff is great but the food just falls flat.  So we come here mainly for the paella and guess what, there was a "hot wheels" sticker in the rice.  How the hell does that get into the food in a full service restaurant.  It didn't stop us from eating, but after a couple of bites, we decided it wasn't good enough to chance what else could be lurking in the dish.  I called the restaurant, and the very friendly server said she would have the manager call me.  No call yet, oh well.
They have definitely improved everything here, the food the service and the over all experience..I just found out they have brunch so I will definitely have to go check that out.

What an amazing little spot in Vegas. I am a vegetarian and for me it is still a little hard to find a restaurant where I can eat well. Their menu has so many vegetarian & gluten free options. I had the Veggie Empanadas and it was incredible. Also, make sure you order the Barcelona Fries. It comes with parmesan cheese and a spicy aioli sauce. So delicious! Luis was our server and he was very courteous and his recommendations were great. For those of you that does't know what Tapas concept is: you get to try small portions of pretty much everything in the menu for only $25.95. So worth it! I recommend this place, nice & cozy little spot in Southern Highlands.
Absolutely delicious and great service. Prices were reasonable for the Tapas. They have a huge variety on the menu. This is definitely a great place to enjoy with friends and enjoy drinks to relax.

We LOVE tapas, and we heard about this place.  Since My wife and I had a restaurant.com gift cert we decided to try it out. The food was great but the service lacked a bit. Here's the breakdown of our meal.

Fried goat cheese--soooo yummy, the balsamic reduction was a great touch

Sliders w/ chipotle aioli and fries -- very flavorful, tender ground beef, well seasoned. The fries are amazing!!

Eggplant canneloni -- my wife chose this because she loves eggplant. She says it was top notch--I liked it, but eggplant is simply not my cup of tea.

Surf and turf -- 3 skewers of shrimp, steak and chorizo. We both really enjoyed this.

House salad -- light and refreshing.

And the best part of the experience??? The deep fried chocolate tres leches a la mode -- simply amazing.

The food was five stars, but the service was a bit slow, and the initial greeting took awhile. Aside from that, we highly recommend Barcelona.
really enjoy this place....great service and the wide variety ensures something for everyone...good or great food is a matter of taste, but to me certain of their dishes are simply sublime!

This was our second time at this establishment. We took some our CA friends there for dinner and it did not disappoint. Even though they were "small bites" that were big enough to share. The chef/owner, Edgar came by the table to make sure everything was okay; it seems like he puts his heart and soul into his food. A bottle of Malbec was $28 which is not bad compared to most high priced eateries on the strip. It is worth checking out is you want something different.
The food is delicious and the service was great. We came here during the lunch hour and did the all you can eat menu. I would recommend everyone try the sautéed mushrooms and patatas bravas

We had the garlic shrimp, fish tacos, bacon wrapped dates, chicken skewers, and salad. It was all superb!  Our waiter was awesome and the service was great. Next time we're in Vegas we will definitely come back.

My husband and I are frequent customers; we have NEVER been disappointed whether we are eating something off the menu or ordering from the all you can eat menu. Not only do we enjoy the quality of the food, we enjoy the fact that our plates are not overflowing with bad food, which I find a complete turn off.........NOT fans of "doggie bags."
This place is about quality, not quantity. This is for Paige, do you know the definition of tapas?
"small Spanish savory dishes, typically served with drinks at a bar." BTW it's a noun.

The service is impeccably spectacular! My BFF and I have been going to Barcelona for a good two years now and we have had nothing but excellent service and wonderfully tasty tapas every time!  Victor is an Angel that brings us our pitcher of tropical mojitos as soon as we sit down at the table and starts suggesting all of the tapas that are new for us to try.  Spicy, sweet, tangy, salty-all of these sensations are what we enjoy with our mojitos and now they even feature escargot with sauteed mushrooms in a garlic sauce that you just want to drink and then lick the plate after you're done eating!! My favorite are the mussles in a spicy soup that you can mop up with fresh cut bagette bread!  Wonderful!  I'm getting hungry just trying to explain it here so that's my cue to head over and enjoy some tapas!

We opted for the all-you-can-eat option. The food was good (skip the bocaronas) as were the cocktails. The place is in a strip mall so points deducted for the location and for the strip-mall-eatery feel of the interior. And one less star for the dry cleaning bill we were left with after the waiter dumped sauce all over my husband's shirt. Yes, the waiter was truly sorry and mortified by the bukkake results he left on my husbands shirt but how about buying him a drink?
Always great food! Love coming back! The fried dates are the best! Will alway come back :)
Food was excellent, the escargot was awesome, and the vegetable empanada killed fireflys.... This place is right by my house and i'm super pumped on how good it was....happy hour is legit....

We came here for a Father's Day dinner, and there are a few things I liked. The atmosphere is great, the food is good, however, the service was lacking. Our server was less than enthusiastic, was not very attentive. We ordered from the AYCE menu, and ordered probably about 8 items to start, between two of us. 4 of those items came out and then we waited, and waited, and waited. Our server came back out to ask if we wanted to order more, and we informed him we were still waiting for the original items we ordered. He informed us we would check on them. A couple more items were brought out, but the mac and cheese never did (the only item I knew my 2 yr old would eat) I reminded him again of the item, meanwhile trying to keep my hungry 2 yr old calm... and it still was the last item to come out, about 30 minutes later. When we asked for our bill, I informed him that we had a $10 off from Restaurant.com before hand, yet he still brought the bill without the discount. The whole process of getting our bill took over 20 minutes. There were only 2 other parties in the restaurant, so it wasn't due to being busy, I think it was just late, and it was just poor service. I'm not sure I would recommend this place, although the food was good. 

Some items I would recommend if you do go, the veggie empanadas, the stuffed artichoke, and the sautéed mushrooms were DELICIOUS.

I would put a zero but it's not possible. We came here for my mother's birthday with a party of 10. The "All you can eat tapas" is not all you can eat. You can only order 5 items at a time with only 2 of the same items and only 36 items per table. We all agreed to their terms THEN they took about 20 mins to take our drinks but THEN decided that we could not get the all you can eat because a few people wanted salads instead of all you can eat. So we all decided on their terms once again and decided to only order a la carte, THEN they said everything had to be on one check and only 3 credit cards were allowed. MIND YOU WE CALLED AHEAD AND RESERVED A TABLE FOR 10 PEOPLE!!! We had no choice but to leave this place. We also ordered a sangria pitcher and had one cup from it and paid full price for it it wasn't even on the house. I'm not judging on food but the service was HORRIBLE and obviously this restaurant isn't prepared for 10 people. We arrived at 6:30pm and left at 7:30 and didn't even eat or order anything besides a drink. RIDICULOUS.
We have been here many times, just wanted to take the time post a review.  Food was yummy, Sangria delish and service was good.  Love this neighborhood place, happy to see them doing well.
I absolutely LOVE this place! Everything ive tried off of their menu has been delicious. Great atmosphere. Nice decor. No complaints!

Okay, I live walking distance from this place but I would drive to go to it like any other restaurant in town. I really like this place and it is reasonably priced for some really good food.

I have to give props to the Diablo shrimp which is off the hook. Seriously, this is an amazing dish and it really isn't as hot as the name implies. Did I mention it was amazing?

For the most part this is a really good restaurant and they work to get everything dialed in. I've eaten here a number of times and have never had a bad experience. If you're not used to tapas don't be afraid to ask questions and experiment a little.

Happy Eating

Well I do hate leaving a bad review on a place with such nice staff and warm and friendly owner but unfortunately a restaurant needs to be more than just a bunch friendly nice people. The quality of the food has got to follow. As much as I really wanted to like the food and was hoping that this place could be a good alternative to Firefly, it just was not. Overall the food was bland, low quality ingredients and clearly nothing is homemade. The worst were the meatballs, avoid them at all costs. They were hard as a rock and no taste. Clearly pre-maid, frozen and re-heated in the microwave (I am single, I know what those taste like!). Second to worst was the manchego and bacon mac&cheese. I had this before in other tapas places and it is a party in your mouth. This one was bland and floury. Not sure how they screwed this one up. 
Also as one would expect portions are small, it is a tapas place. I have no issue with small portion but it needs to burst with flavor.  On a good note, the bacon wrapped dates are good. 
Don't think I will be going back but if I do, I will stick to the sangria and the dates.

Went with a date - thought it was a nicer franchise from East Coast I'd been to in CT. Isn't, so I was worried.

Ordered camarones diablo (spicy shrimp), sauteed musrooms, and calamari.  The shrimp and diablo sauce was just great. So good we both used it on the calamari instead of the (mundane) sauce which came with that. The mushrroms were wonderful also. Asked for some peppers for calamari, and they sliced some fresh jalapenos for us.

Prices seemed very reasonable for the quality.

Service was superb and they stuck around well past closing to let us finish. Compliments to the staff and chef!

The greatest Tapas in Las Vegas, go somewhere else and sample ok tapas but Barcelona sets the standard! But that's not all, the service and atmosphere make this place a great experience!! If your looking for a place filled with top ten muzak, bad service and fried bar food this is not the place for you.

Let it be known that I made a Yelp account to review this place. That's how bad this place is. 

Let's just say that the best thing about Barcelona Tapas is its proximity to Smiths, where you can buy alcohol after your meal to drown your sorrows because you just paid $22 for food you could make better completely wasted. 

My husband, friend, and I decided to try this place based off reviews and the fact that it is close to our home. We were really hoping for a decent, reasonably priced restaurant we could frequent. What we found was a restaurant that none of us will ever return to unless we are forced by violence or perhaps paid copious amounts of money. 

Exaggerations aside, save your money. If you are expecting an experience and quality similar to that of Firefly (pre-food poisoning fiasco) then be prepared to be disappointed. This review will be covering the ALL YOU CAN EAT (AYCE) DINNER menu. 

To be honest, the restaurant should be sued for false advertising - it should be called YOU CAN EAT SAMPLES. Have you been to Costco or Sam's Club? You know the samples they pass out on busy days that you gulp down in one bite? That is all you can order off the AYCE menu. I know, I know. You're wondering - what?! It clearly says chicken SKEWERS! With an S! Ah, if only the individuals running the business had a strong understanding of the English language. Let me tell you: IT IS ONE. ONE OF EVERYTHING? Stuffed mushroom? ONE MUSHROOM. Chicken skewers? ONE SKEWER. ONE! If you knew this going in, you might not be irritated. You might think, okay. Chicken skewer. My husband and I are eating, so let me order 4 chicken skewers so we can have two each. But the menu implies others (what with the restaurant owner not understanding the difference between plural and singular nouns) so you order one chicken SKEWERS, thinking you will get two or three. You wait twenty minutes and are presented with a tiny stick with the smallest amount of chicken on it, so small that you seriously utter, "what the ****?" You consume it in .0004 seconds and request 6 more, waiting 20 more minutes for them to arrive. Did I mention there's a 90 minute limit? I am not sure if the errors are intentional or not, but they are definitely frustrating to any customer who is fluent in the English language. 

While you are eagerly waiting for your chicken SKEWERS (at this point you're still thinking you're going to get 2 or 3), you observe the chef talking to every table...except yours. Firstly, if Gordon Ramsay were in da house, he would be wondering why the hell the chef is out of the kitchen more than he is in it. That aside, the chef seemed to frequent tables who did not purchase AYCE or tables occupied by older guests. We were the only table that appeared to be mid-20s and apparently we did not deserve a hello or greeting from the chef. We also were not greeted when we arrived. 

The chef actually finally came to our table after our friend requested that the waitress remove an item from his check because it was basically inedible. The chef came and yes, he did ask what he could do to fix it or make our experience better. My friend looked at me and I shrugged, at which point he responded that there wasn't anything to be done, thank you, but we're going to finish up, leave, and never return. The chef became somewhat aggressive, again questioning how he could remedy the terrible experience. I ask you, fellow Yelpers - how do you tell a chef that the only way to fix your experience is to construct a working time machine so that you can teleport two hours back in time and avoid ever coming to his restaurant in the first place? I'm not sure there's a nice way to say that. 

Sure, there were dollar beers. That come in mini 8 oz glasses and taste like cucumber or a more evil version of Budweiser. They are likely $1 because the chef is hoping you'll get wasted on them and forget how god awful the food is. 

Not only was the quality of the food THOROUGHLY mediocre (and that's me being generous) but the service was "meh." Yes, my water was constantly filled. But do you know how many times it took for me to get a SLIDER with no sauce? 3 times. Ordered a slider with no sauce. Slider arrived with sauce. Ordered another. Slider arrived with no sauce but also no pickle, which was clearly something to be included on the slider. Ordered again. Finally slider arrived with no sauce and the pickle on it. Then, randomly ten minutes later, another slider arrived with sauce. Even the waitress was shaking her head at the total ineptness of the kitchen staff. Not to mention the mistakes with table numbering. 

Bottom line, save yourself tears and misery and eat somewhere else. Seriously. You'd be just as happy buying $25  worth of frozen food at Smiths.
Amazing tapas and excellent service! Great prices too. Sangria is great! Live music too!

The only thing worse than the service is the food. It had to be the first time the server had ever taken an order.  He couldn't figure out some simple requests so the manager came and apologized and then started criticizing the server to us. The manager forgot two things from our order, brought half the tables food out 10 minutes before the other half AND forgot one whole meal all together (there was four of us). The penne pasta's sauce was literally water, no joke. The hash browns were as white as the plate. The only good thing they did was comp us when we got up to walk out
Make sure you go hungry!!! The dècor is beautiful and fun plus they have a full bar!!! Just make sure to get a good mixture of dishes so you don't overload on carbs

Wow this place is excellent!!!!The food is OUTSTANDING!!!!That petit filet.....i'll just say order two and for $16 bucs you've eaten Ruths Chris filet mignon!!!!
Keep in mind it is an "Tapas" restaurant,so food is served in small portions (apetizers).Order as if your at a sushi bar and try different items!
Prices are great and they even have half off happy hour on fridays 4-6pm on tapas!!!4 bucs for each item....SWEEEET

This is one of my favorite places to go for a weeknight dinner or even an occasion. I live in the neighborhood so I visit Barcelona Tapas at least twice a month. 

Casual Dining Weeknight Experience:
I have always received a friendly greeting at the door. The waiter/waitress is always very prompt with bringing over some fresh bread with honey butter and hummus, which is outstanding. I prefer the Sangria at Barcelona, the white-red mix is definitely the way to go. The wait staff always have time to check on the food and the experience, a nice addition to service at a neighborhood restaurant. Overall, I've always had great service. The menu and food is comparable to Firefly, in fact I sometimes feel like they ripped off the menu, which isn't a bad thing. My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, the albondigas, the empanadas,  the chicken skewers, and the stuffed mushrooms are very good! The food quality at Barcelona definitely gives Firefly a run for its money and the wait staff actually come back and chat with you. At a busy Tapas place like Firefly(although it's super fun for a party) you don't get the personal experience. Also they have live music sometimes which is AWESOME! Spanish style guitar, so romantic!

Large Group Dining:
Last year I had my birthday dinner here. The restaurant handled the additional 30 people on a busy Saturday night with calm and provided the best service. Everyone got everything they ordered and in a timely manner. The waiter assigned to our party did a really great job making sure the drinks and food kept coming. We made a reservation a few days in advance just to let them know ahead of time and it truly was a great dinner.
Food excellent...Wednesday afternoon bar to myself, lot of complaints about it to busy, then don't come for happy hour...cheap bas?$#ds...food is great

Despite the mixed reviews, we thought we'd check out this place for a glass of wine on our way home. Sure, it was 10 minutes before closing, but there were several people still dining, so we thought a glass of wine wouldn't be out of the question. Immediately upon entering we were met with, "Sorry, we're closed." Ok, I didn't realize restaurants closed at 9:50pm. There were at least five people still dining and drinking, and instead of engaging new customers we were shut down. This could have been a great opportunity to get some new customers and make some money while the other customers finished up their meals, but instead this relationship ended before it started. One star for bad customer service.

Before I decided to check this place out, I had heard some great things. I decided to take my girlfriend here on a date, since we're both huge tapas restaurant fans. 

We get to Barcelona's and were seated by a hostess. The waiter comes up, brings us water then disappears. He never introduced himself, nor did he show any interest in taking our order. It took about 10 minutes before he came back to take our order. 

The food was great. Everything was cooked perfectly, leaving my girlfriend and i impressed. We asked for the check and gave the waiter the coupon we had bought off one of those group coupon websites. He instantly became hostile claiming that it was more work for him because he had to activate it and deduct it from the final check.  He returned and threw the check in front of me. He never once said thank you, or even came back to check on our drinks. I finished the check and we left.

He followed me into the parking lot and asked for a signature, which I had forgotten to do out of irritation. The gentlemen began to tell me I shouldn't be angry about the coupon situation that it was just more work for him. I had never seen any waiter be so assertive. I told him I was upset about the fact that he didn't check on us once during our meal. He than said, "I don't need your excuses." My excuses for what? For not tipping him? He didn't deserve a tip considering how rude he was. He stormed off and called me an a**hole at the door of the restaurant as he was walking in.  After leaving I attempted to call the restaurant for a manager, but the phone kept going to voicemail. This was during business hours by the way.

I'm sorry but that was unacceptable. Not even in the most run down places in town do you have the waiter insult you. Even these waiters are more gracious than this guy.  Horrible service. No matter how good the food was, I will not be returning. 

I will give this place 1 star because of the food. It deserves a zero for the customer service. Get rid of this guy, he's ruining your restaurant.

Que horror!  This place bills itself as a Spanish restaurant, but it most certainly is not.  In terms of the ambiance and décor, think of it as Cabo San Lucas, Spain.  They had merengue music playing in the background, if that gives you any indication.  

I could forgive the cultural inauthenticity if the food had been good, but it was not.  I ordered the tortilla de patata (Spanish omelet).  It was so rubbery, I expected to see "Spalding" stamped on the underside.  Cooking is about more than hitting buttons on a microwave.      

I guess the owners, who I hear are Salvadoran and Puerto Rican, think all they need to do is put up a couple of pictures of bulls and the FC Barcelona flag, and they have created a Spanish restaurant.  Some of us (especially those of us who actually are Spaniards) can tell the difference.

Such a pleasant surprise.  I am a frequent customer at firefly and was hoping to find something a bit closer to home and a bit less expensive.  A friend told me about Barcelona tapas and i loved it! The food was delicious and the service was wonderful. They were getting ready to close and insisted we stay and eat regardless.  They went the extra mile, and that is never lost on me.

I've tried this place 3 times since moving to Vegas a few months ago.  

Food is ok, nothing special.  I've been to much better places back home that I wouldn't even put this in my top 10 list.  

The sangria is not bad, but I can whip up the same concoction at home.

With the VERY limited selection of spanish tapas bars in Vegas, I would probably frequent this place if ONLY they know how to treat their customers.  Servers are rude, slow, oblivious, and unattentive.  The only friendly person at that place is the female bartender (same bartender 3 times I was there).  

Ok food/drinks and REALLY BAD SERVICE...I don't think I'll be coming back here anytime soon.

This place is a total rip off! The meals are so teeeeny weeeny and expensive! I ordered a soup and only had like 5 sips and that was it! That was my meal?  I could understand if the food was excellent but its not. So why overprice the food. The food isnt "bad," its just ok. Whoever said the prices are reasonable is an idiot.

I love this place! The food is unique and very tasty. I really loved their beef carpaccio with a hint of truffle oil. YUM! Everything I tasted was wonderful, the only thing that I didn't absolutely love was the empanadas - still good, but not my fav. 

I gave this place an extra star for Jose, the waiter. He was hilarious and very sweet. 

Locals: keep an eye out for coupons, 20% off your entire meal makes this place even better.

Very good happy hour menu and prices. Large menu can please lots of people. Some regularly priced items are a bit expensive but everything we tried in my party of three was fresh, tasty and good. I got iced tea which was excellent. Staff was professional and attentive. We stayed a little long at our table to talk to a friend we hadn't seen in a long while but the staff didn't mind.

Sorry to write that Barcelona is struggling.   The food is still excellent but service has fallen off a cliff.   We took a group of 12 on December 26 with reservations for 6:30.  Took more than 2 hours have a tapas dinner -  we ordered 3 of some things to share and 1 would come then 15 minutes later 2 more... The staff excuse for having to wait interminably was that it was the last night for a groupon coupon.  So full price diners like us ($335) suffered so that the groupons could be served at a discount.  By the end we passed on desert, etc because we were all so frustrated.   WIll try again some time but the food is dishonored by the service.
Get the beef & chicken skewers, veggie empanadas, mac & cheese, bacon covered dates, and tacos.
The pitcher of sangria is an awesome deal. The macaroni and cheese is delicious. The vegetable empanadas are my favorite

We had lunch here yesterday, March 12th.  It was very disappointing, especially for the price paid.  My husband and I each ordered 2 small plates of tapas and each had one glass of sangria.  Our lunch bill, not including the tip, was $60!!!!!  The sangria did not even have chopped fruit in it, as did every other glass of sangria I had ever purchased at other restaurants. Sixty plus dollars was an outrageous price to pay for lunch.  We will not be back.  Las Vegas has too many other places to try.  We were excited, as Barcelona is just blocks from my son's house in Southern Highlands.  He had given this restaurant a few tries.  He said he will not be back either.

First time here and we had the "All you can eat", lunch for $18 each.  Everything was excellent,  be warned - the Patas Bravas is good and hot!!!  The service was excellent and we were seated quickly.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because we haven't eaten there for dinner yet.  This is definitely on our list for when we visit Vegas.  This is casual dining and great atmosphere!  By the way this is Spanish Tapas!

I love this place! Great food and sangria. Plus they had live entertainer which was perfect! It's in my neighborhood and it took me a long time but I finally went and was very happy I did. Highly recommend it.

We wanted a nice convenient spot with good food, draft beer and decent service [sad that that's not easy to find but I digress]. We'd never been to Barcelona but decided to give it a try. Wow, we've been missing out on a local gem. I had no idea this was a chef owned restaurant, I would have tried it sooner! Friendly, quick service, reasonably priced draft beer and outstanding food. As I sipped my $5 Blue Moon and pondered the menu Viktor brought us some warm toasted bread with honey butter and warm humus (yum). I was already impressed. We wanted to be a little healthy so we had the house salad which is a nice mix of fresh greens, apples, candied walnuts and just the right amount of bleu cheese. Very nice. We also had the bruschetta, chicken tacos (excellent), and shrimp ceviche (best I've ever had, and I've eaten at some fancy celebrity chefs tapas spots on the Strip). Next time I want to try the chicken skewers, the homemade humus and feta, and stuffed piquillo peppers...hopefully that still leaves room for the shrimp ceviche. Don't hesitate to give this little local gem a try.

Updated from my earlier review:
You're right, Edgar, the only thing you did wrong was to allow Gabriel Guel to represent himself as your business. Hopefully you've corrected that now.

Great Place , great environment, friendly servers. The beauty of this place is that you can either go for  lunch or dinner and the place always  has a good vibe. Their Sangria is among the best i have ever tried.

LOOOVE this place we went to Vegas for a family trip last week and we were staying at a residence that is about a block away from here and we loved the Tapas here. We loved it so much we came here twice in our 4 day trip. 

The pulled pork was my favorite and the ribs. A must try are the Stuffed shrimp and the papatas bravas. 

The sangria is bomb! we ordered 2 pitchers of it. not very strong. the waitress on the first day was amazing, very upbeat. but on our 2nd night the gentelman was very slow and very disrespectful in my opinion he would not ask if we needed anything just looked at us until we told him our order. Because of him my rating is not 5 stars.

the ambiance of the resturant is casual and its lighted on the dark side. not too much light but very nice and they have screens everywhere with sports events.
Unpretentious, good food, friendly service, great value.

This can be summed up very quickly...

Food = Delicious, everything we've tried.  In particular, I loved the pan fried dates and my boyfriend had a thing for the garlic shrimp. We both thought the food was much tastier and of better quality than Jaleo, but admittedly we haven't tried Firefly.  Prices are reasonable and ambiance is open and inviting.  

Service = Wildcard.  Sometimes fantastic, sometimes neglectful. All depends on who is working. If Barcelona could create a consistent, top notch service, this place should do great.

It's pretty much a typical bar environment, nothing special in the decor or ambience, similar to a PT's pub and the like. The food is okay, I had the ribs, and guests I was with ordered the sliders. The ribs were served in a sweet sauce that tasted like any that could be found in a Kraft jar. They weren't horrible, and they weren't great. The sliders weren't anything to write home about, as the meat quality was average at best. The fries were quite good, however shouldn't be a determining factor for patrons. 

The determining factors in this case: The service is horrible, and food is average at best. These two facts, coupled together should be a deal-breaker. It is as if they take pride in offering poor service. The wait staff would place the wrong orders in front of the customer, and did not seem to care if people are satisfied. They did this both with the drinks, and later with the entrees. One guest at our table had to wait ten minutes for ketchup, and when we finally got a waiter's attention, he was visibly annoyed at our request. On a side note-the coffee tasted like it had been sitting in the pot all day before being served. 

Strangely enough, if I see reviews for good food and poor service, I'm not deterred, as I see it like a 'soup nazi' situation: The food should be so outstanding that people overlook the horrible customer service in order to experience good tastes. 

In the case of Barcelona Tapas & Bar, I recommend avoiding this place, as the poor service does not justify the lackluster food served and the atmosphere is uncomfortable. 

I think the fancy name 'tapas' makes a place like this appear special, but in my case, it is simply a place to avoid.

Love, love, love this place!
The food is amazing and it's close to home. Would eat here all day everyday if my waistline would allow it .
Food was delicious! Ambiance was nice and clam. Servers were polite. I'm excited to go back.

So good and the staff is friendly! 

Just remember to try their pan fried dates and the lamb along with a sangria.

Este lugar en un insulto a la gastronomía española. 

This place insults the Spain gastronomy.

I love this place. I tried the location in Southern Highlands.

Great selection of tapas. The food is of the highest quality. My favorite is the paella dish, I ordered it with seafood only and it was absolutely delicious. It is good for 2-4 people. 

The interior is good. The place is not big. It's cozy and feels warm. 

The staff is very friendly. 

I will definitely come back again.
Nice comfortable little place with great tasting tapas. The stuffed piquillo peppers are fantastic!
T gave us BEST  service, genuine kind lady who enjoys her job. great sangria. Tapas were very good. fried dates wrapped in bacon!!! Tacos are as good as anywhere. even house salad was great
This is the place to go to in Las Vegas for seafood paella. I am in love with this restaurant, the food and the service.

This place should have a line wrapped around the corner!! All you can eat lunch & dinner menus are the way to go- I highly suggest stuffed dates. Similar tapas selection to FireFly with better atmosphere and prices, will definitely be back

It's one of the first tapas places here in Las Vegas I knew of 3 years ago. So I love it!! than the over Hyped bullshit Firefly Tapas joint that I definately know, came later!! Barcelona is the first place I found, because of a friend of mine. Then this bullshit Firefly place came along, and it can go, on the wannabe list. At least the employees who work @ Barcelona aren't stuck up, like the employees at Firefly.  Firefly employees can shove their attitudes right back up their own taints!!! Or else I'll do it for them with my foot!!!!!! Barcelona Tapas!!  Puta Madre!!!!!
Hell yeah!!!
Four of us went for happy hour. Ordered a variety of tapas and didn't have anything we didn't love.  The drinks were good - loved their sangria especially.

I discovered Barcelona Tapas & Bar while going through those 80 percent-off offers at Restaurant.com. Given its way-out-of-the-way location, I'd likely have otherwise not heard of it. After a few months of the $25 certificate sitting in our kitchen drawer, my girlfriend and I finally decided to make the trek out to Southern Highlands to check out this tapas joint. 

I was nervous at first; the Yelp! reviews were not encouraging. Everyone was basically saying the service was terrible, the place was too loud, and the food paled in comparison to Firefly (a favorite), especially for the price. But we gave it a go anyway, and ...

I'm glad we did.

We went on a Friday night, which you'd expect to be a super-busy time, but it wasn't. Aside from one big party seated near the bar, the remaining booths were only half-occupied. We were greeted by the server/host immediately upon entering, and seated right away. He got our drink orders in before we even had to open the menus. Throughout our meal, we had servers constantly checking in on us, refilling water, etc. So, for us, the service was super.

The food? Pretty good in general. The patatas bravas were tasty, though could have been a hair spicier. The tortilla espanola was very satisfying, a thick, fluffy omelet that -- I hate to compare -- puts Firefly's to shame. I assume my girl enjoyed her manchego mac & cheese, because she ate it all. Even the toasted bread served with the meal (accompanied by a garbanzo bean dip and garlic cheese butter) was good. 

The only thing that was not awesome was the tuna tartare. While it was inspired to serve it with tostada chips (that almost tasted like wontons!), the tuna was bland, even with accompanying pineapple cubes.

But that's the great thing about tapas -- you try a bunch of things, and some hit, some miss.

The red sangria we had was also very good. Not too sweet, not too strong, a good mix of wine and fruit. Someone else here thought it was too sweet. Maybe they had the white? We'll have to try next time.

I don't know how soon we'll be back based solely on Barcelona's location (although we made it a date night with a movie at Southpoint, which was only about five minutes from there), but we'd definitely recommend anyone in the area try it. And if you go to their website, you can get $25 in dining for only $10. You can get better deals on sites like Restaurant.com, but Barcelona's in-house coupon has fewer restrictions on use.
The happy hour here is the shit! The hot bartender, Lizzett I think her name is, amazing! That girl knows her stuff. The tapas speak for themselves. Yum!!! Addicted!
The food is amazing with such a big selection and the prices are very reasonable! Great sangria and the wait staff is excellent

Highly recommend this restaurant. We were a party of five and everyone loved the experience. Food was great with choices for everyone. Service was attentive! All of us will most defiantly be returning.

Great price! Great food! Excellent service! Victor was amazing and let us know all of the best choices. Definitely try the beef and pastor tacos!
The only disappointment was that we were here because of Groupon and the owner/manager changed the rules, so we weren't able to use it.
Victor made us feel better with his kindness and inside tip to check in on Yelp for a free sangria. 
We'll be back!!!

This place just took us back to our days living in southern Spain! The tapas were all super delicious and the staff here is so warm and friendly.  If you want a little taste of Spain in a nice ambient atmosphere for a fair price this is the place to come. Next time we are in Vegas we will definitely come here again.  *Be sure to check Groupon to see if they have any deals available. We got a pretty good deal on our food BC of this.  Enjoy! :)

This restaurant is located in a nice southern highlands shopping center. I have passed it up before due to the yelp reviews but my boyfriend and I bought a groupon so we decided to try it. 

We were immediately greeted. When we sat down, our drink orders were taken right away. My boyfriend had a $5 draft beer, he was happy with the reasonable price. We ordered a variety of tapas, we had the 
mac&cheese, the stuffed peppers, the bacon wrapped dates, the sausage, spicy shrimp, and some ham and cheese croquettes. Everything was delicious! The spicy shrimp was my favorite, but the dates were a close second.

I would recommend this place to anyone who likes to try a little bit of everything on the menu.  :)

The service was really great and the food was even better!

I absolutely loved this place! I wish I could remember the name of our waitress. She was extremely attentive and kept sending food to our table until we couldn't eat anymore. 
Hubby and I did the AYCE, $24pp. We have been to tapa places and spent more than that on only a few items. The dates wrapped in bacon were our favorite, along with the empanadas. Tacos were good, and so were the skewers. Mac n cheese was kinda plain and the meatball wasn't to our taste, but everything else was excellent. Desert is included in the price, and we had flan and the chocolate tres leches. Delicious!
Love this place! Great drinks, great food, great atmosphere for both family and date night. One of my favorites in LV!

We're from Los Angeles and I wish this place would duplicate itself and be right be my house.  I. can't comprehend how the prices are so low for the high quality ingredients they use but I'm impressed.  Wow.  We got the all you can eat dinner and the food kept coming and it was delish.

AMAZING. Food is delicious. I ordered the chicken penne pasta and my girlfriend ordered the Zaerz... Something lol and both were delicious. The complimentary bread with butter and humus as to die for. The service was AMAZING. Our waiter (Victer) was constantly refilling drinks, taking plates, bringing bread, explaining what everything was and polite. 

The only thing is we ordered jalapeño poppers but they never came. HOWEVER, they were not on the bill and we did not need them. We were stuffed. 

GREAT GREAT PLACE. We have been here twice because we visit from Cali. This will be a stop with every trip.

Disappointed !!!  Went to try Paella - not good at all.  Just wonder if the chef had a authentic Paella from Spain,  I guess not :(

Not going back and will keep trying other restaurants until I find the real Paella.

We come here about once a month. We like it, but I wouldn't say it's fantastic. Both the food and the service are inconsistent - some nights they are on the ball, some nights everything is off. I have had some food here that is incredible (bananas foster) and some that's not good at all (albondigas soup). Also, they changed the recipe for the patatas bravas, I wish they'd make them the old way, they used to be great!

We went during happy hour where they have both food and drink specials. Everything tasted great! They start the meal with bread and two different delicious dipping sauces. We ordered the croquetas, the stuffed artichokes, steak and chicken skewers, chicken piccata, and the dessert empanadas. They all were great! We can't wait to go back!

Always delicious tapas at a local spot.  No need to drive to the Aria for tapas if you're feeling low key. 

My favs for years, shareable or enjoy alone at the bar as I do sometime.  

Stuffed Piquillo Peppers w/ goat cheese
Albondigas which are Spanish meatballs
Fried goat cheese, to die for
Sliders
Filet Mignon Medallions so tender!
Stuffed Mushrooms 
Bacon wrapped Dates a must & the best ever.  Crispy & sweet!
Apple & Manchego Cheese Salad Absolutely a must & super healthy.  A perfect pair.  
Chorizo Bilbao, Empanadas & Croquetas are also a must.  
The best dessert ever is the Chocolate Tres Leches so save room for it!

I like to order slowly so either I don't get full all at once or I like to enjoy the tapas as my own kind of Prix Fixe menu.  The tapas come out kind of quick, but hot.  Super good!

Having lived in the area for a few months, finally took an opportunity to stop in here the other night.
3 words:  Uh-May-Zing!  Sat at the bar with our group of 3 and ordered some sangria and other cocktails.  We munched on several different tapas that were on the menu.  None to disappoint!  Everything was delicious!  The atmosphere was fun on a Friday night, great service, very friendly bartender.  Not sure what else I would have asked for besides a massage or some free play (video poker...I know someone strayed there...).

Ultimately this place solidifies my decision to move into this area even further.  What a great little neighborhood spot!  I plan to become a regular!

My experience here was horrible. A friend and I were looking to grab some food and we stumbled on this place on indicard. We walked in and the place was empty, that should have been the first sign. The waitress informed us that they had an all you can eat tapas menu. We tried almost everything. Most of it was bland with no flavoring. We only found 2 things we liked. When it came to paying we told them we would like to use our indicard discount which is 30% off total tab. (They even have an indicard sticker on the door) I was than told I couldn't use it because I was already getting a deal. On the indicard it says 30% off total tab excluding happy hour. It does not say not on all you can eat. I asked the owner if he would still honor it and he said no because we would be getting two promotions. I told him the only reason we came was because of indicard and it did not say that on there. He straight up said he was not honoring it. The owner was extremely rude about the whole thing as well (talking down on me). I would never come here again or recommend it to anyone. The food is horrible and the service is as well.

This place is way out of the way for visitors staying on the strip...but it's a good place to stop by for happy hour if you're in the neighborhood. They have happy hour everyday from 4pm to 7pm I believe and tapas are all half off! Super casual and friendly walk-in restaurant. 

The bill for our group of 5 totaled to about $100, excluding tip but including all the non-alcoholic drinks we ordered. For tapas...we got the following:

manchego mac n cheese x2 (yummy x2)
ham & cheese croquettes x2 (you can't have just one!)
bbq ribs x2 (if you're a rib fan, go for it)
chorizo sausage x2 (a must have)
pan fried dates (so so good! You gotta try it to believe it!)
stuffed mushrooms (eh, pass)
mashed potatoes (not much to say, but they were good)
patatas bravas (unique, potato wedges wrapped with bacon & drizzled with a slightly tangy/spicy sauce)
sliders (meat was too dry and over cooked, ick)
shrimp skewers (not bad)
garlic shrimp (needs more garlic, but tasty)
stuffed shrimp (the stuffing was overwhelming)
petit filet (meat was cooked well but the sauce was too sour/tart)
chicken cake (think crabcake but with chicken)
eggplant cannoli (nothing to rave about)
chicken wings (didn't try these)

That is as much as I can remember...I may have forgotten about a few items, but needless to say, we all left with major food coma!

If you've been to Spain like I have then it is difficult to give this place more than three stars. I did enjoy the service and ambiance and it is located 2 minutes from my house so I'll definitely be back. The free bread and dips were tasty and the garlic butter shrimp was amazing. I'd recommend this place to someone who was craving tapas and lived nearby.

This place has totally gone down hill. It used to be our "go to place" with friends, family and out of town guests. The last about 6 times we have been, the service has been horrendous, the food has been mediocre at best and the ambience leaves seems to be lacking. Sometimes they have a band that plays mariachi so loudly you can't hear yourself talk. They used to have "all you can eat." But now, there are all these special rules and times- and we haven't been able to experience the last 6 times we were there. This last time was the worst- our waiter made us wait because "I'm by myself and it's not my fault and not my problem." It was supposed to be "$1 tacos" that day. At 12:15 pm they were completely out of tacos. So crazy. It's just not enjoyable to go to anymore.

First time coming here. The food and atmosphere is great. But I was not impressed with the server. I told our server this was our first time here and never tried paella. So she told us to order that first, which the paella was great. But the server forgot to come back to take the rest of our order for our part (kids). That was annoying because our kids were hungry and it was taking forever. Let's just say we pretty much finished our paella and the sever has not came by it place our order.

Not impressed the place was empty and when that is the case the chef should wonder why.
I love croquets alas no flavor at all, salad drenched in vinegar, delicious artichoke , very mediocre bacon dates , all told on Friday all you can eat is 25,95 instead of 18,95 a big difference so in the end it was not cheap either.
Won't be back sorry.

I have wicked cravings for their fried goat cheese on a daily basis.  They're goddamned ridiculous and probably the best thing I've ever tasted.  I mean, they literally melt in your mouth.  And I'm not even a fat person.  That says something.

Other than that, the usual stuff applies.  The service is decent.. Melissa served us last night and was busy but yet very nice and attentive.  The Sangria is sweet and thankfully sold by the pitcher.  The restaurant is small and fun.

I could compare Firefly and Barcelona, but there really isn't any point.  Tapas is tapas and both places are decent to me.
Our server was very good! The Mac n cheese was fantastic!! I would asking recommend the shrimp diablo! We had the bananas foster was good!

Ill start with saying unique! The taste chef puts out is like no other. Being from Las Vegas I always look for new places to test the palette. This one has become a family favorite for many years. I must recommend the house made sangria white or red; is to die for alongside the bacon wrapped dates! Highly recommended to all friends and families!

We really liked Barcelona. The blacktop was being replaced so we thought they were closed but they were not. It was just us so we got exceptional service. What we ordered was good. We will have to go and explore some more as we were already eating some place else that night. We will go back to taste more for sure.

I'm not sure about this place. I've come here twice and both times left unsatisfied. My most recent visit, I opted for the all you can eat tapas which was $20 each. Between my GF and myself, we ordered probably 15 small plates. Some of them the meats were dried out and clearly not fresh. There was only 2 or 3 items that were truly delicious, the rest were just ok. I'll probably come back one more time but def won't do the all you can eat.

The host and waitress were very friendly. They have half-off on their tapas during cocktail hours. So, a coupon is useless here because they charge you the regular prices instead of half-off to use the coupon, therefore canceling the supposed 50% discount from the coupon. Clever !

The food is average. Nothing comparable to the real tapas in Spain or NYC. The paella was served with a large amount of very sticky rice with no saffron flavor. The tapas were better but nothing special. The sangria was without fruity flavor but has high alcohol content. It is a place for young people to drink and socialize, maybe.

This is my BF's go-to bar,/restaurant, which is convenient since it's right down the street from him.  The staff is awesome (especially Mel at the bar), and the food is yummy.  Great Happy Hour deals too, but I think we usually miss those.  I'm totally craving the stuffed dates right now!

Came here and there was a live band, the place in general had a very authentic feel to it; between the food, the music, the servers..I definitely did not feel like I was in Vegas. A nice restaurant to get away from the usual. The All you can eat tapas is a must and their sangria isn't too bad either.

This spot is one of our go to low key hangouts, good service and great food. The plates are big enough to share with 2, we usually order a bunch off the happy hour and dig in to everything. The michaladas are really good with there home made mix. Def recommend if you are looking for a quick bite in a low key spot.

This place is AMAAAAZING!

The food is delicious and the service is outstanding! We have ordered our meals individually and as 'all you can eat'. We favor the all you can eat because it's 'portion size' and I know that defeats the 'all you can eat' mentality but we just eat until we're full and we love that we can really try an assortment of dishes. When they first come out, they bring the bread with hummus and some butter/peppery spread (which both are awesome) and take your drink order. 

We then let them know we're doing all you can eat

Seriously, we always start with:

Beef Empanadas
Fried Calamari
Croquetas
Sautéed Mushrooms
Albondigas
2 Brochetas de Carne (steak skewers)
Setas Rellenas
Mac N Cheese
Ravioli

Yes...ALL THIS...if you try this specific order, you can get a general idea of the 'tastes of Barcelona'. When you're done try everything else. You'll love it! 

The greatest server is Luis and we love the owner, Edgar too, he's fabulous!

Enjoy!!

PS: Ask for a pitcher of Lemonade..he knows how to hook it up!

My wife and I have been here at least a dozen times. Food and service are always amazing! If you are
In the mood for something spicy, the Tacos Al Pastor are a must!

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!

Wow!  First time here and it does not disappoint!  Absolutely everything we had was fresh and delicious!  We did the $25 all you an eat.  Best sangria and fireball ever!  A few favorites on the all you can eat were the salad, calamari, pork empanadas and we loved the sauce.  Tacos were also great.  Out server Cynthia was a pleasure and gave us great service.  Wonderful experience and close to home in Southern Highlands.  Love it!!!!!

I like that the owner is hands-on in this establishment.  The food is of good quality, always served hot and fresh.  Pricing is fairly reasonable as well.  The ambience is quite good, it gets busy some days but we're fairly satisfied with both the food and the service.

Attended the World Cup finals at Barcelona Tapas & Bar on Sunday and had a BLAST!  They offered their full menu, which is extensive.  We had both the red and white sangria and both were the best I've tasted yet.  Not too sweet and  very refreshing.

We were a table of 10 and just kept ordering & sharing.  The lamb sausage was soooo good and surprisingly spicy; potatas bravas (sp?) were very nice with a oregano and a hint of mint; pan-fried dates were such a party in my mouth - they were wrapped in bacon & topped with a bit of blue cheese; both the chicken and pork empanadas we cooked beautifully but I have to admit I preferred the pork; sauteed mushrooms were very flavorful and again cooked perfectly; the shrimp skewers had a tasty but not too spicy seasoning; and I wanted to keep slurping the steamed mussels broth!  We finished everything off with bananas foster and I was again very pleased with the balance of flavors.

I was very impressed with the quality of the food, especially considering they were literally packed wall-to-wall with futbal fans (go Spain!).  Service was very good - I don't how they kept up! The layers of flavors were balanced nicely and the seasonings perfectly complemented each dish without overpowering it.  I was also impressed that they didn't over salt their dishes so the true flavors came out.

Bravo Barcelona!  We'll see you again I'm sure :-)
love this place! Always satisfied with their tapas selections. They used to have bottomless mimosas, but I don't think they do that anymore. But either way, I go back for the food all the time.

A great tapas bar with many menu choices. I actually went down to Southern Highlands for Uncle Al's hot dogs, but to my dismay, the place was closed. Not sure if Closed down or closed, but I didn't see any food in the place (ketchup, mustard, etc).

So, I ended up at Barcelona. Let me tell you, I was pleasantly surprised with the food, service and "drank." Let's break this down into categories. 

Food:
Pan Fried Dates - Excellent and highly recommended. For those that have been to Firefly's, they are essentially the same. Bacon wrapped dates, with Blue Cheese. 

Sliders - Sliders come as 2 mini burgers and are just fine. Of course, I always say you can't ruin a burger that much when they are so simple. 

Abodingos (sp?) AKA Meatballs - Tasty little guys come in a marinara like sauce with lots of cheese. 

Empanadas - There are two types to choose from. I had the chicken, but the alternative is Pork. Chicken was chosen because my friend doesn't eat pork. However, the chicken empanadas were excellent.

Fruit Parfait - The parfait was sweet and tasty. Raspberry, Strawberry and blueberries, with whip cream and a sweet yogurt like mixture. 

Sangria - Thursday night is 1/2 off Sangria night. This means it's $3 per glass. Not too shabby and a good sized glass too. 

Atmosphere:
I have mixed feelings on the atmosphere. Walls were great, but the tables were a bit small for me and I am only 6'2". My knees hit the top of the tables. However, there were booths that looked like they had more room. It was a Lakers game night so it was rowdy because we were the only Lakers fans in the place. Every else was for Boston. :-( 

Service:
Food was fast, and service was excellent. It was more personal then most places. Waiter recommended, talked about the game, chit chatted and more. 



 Pan frie dates. Sliders. Meatballs. Parfait for dessert. Empanadas. Full bar, somewhat interesting atmosphere.
Excellent food and superb service! Loved it there. Management was on point. Love their selection of food! Will come here again!

Absolutely our favorite restaurant from breakfast to the all you can eat.  I've never had a bad meal or drink from there.  The staff is amazing and food is better than any place around! They have great happy hour specials but prices are extremely reasonable all day long too.  It doesn't get any better than Barcelona!!

Ate there a few times with my husband.  Food is just ok... not really Spanish.  More like Mexican with not enough spice.  Also made the mistake of  telling my daughter to go there with her boyfriend.  They were treated like dirt.  She had a coupon and asked the server if she could use it.  She said sure. Turns out the person taking the order was the bus person, not the waiter.  When she presented the coupon to the waitress  she went to the  owner who screamed at her, said she couldn't use it, took her money and refused to give her a dollar back of her change.  I will never go back there again and neither will she. Mistreating customers because they're young is just plain stupid.. or is ti because they are an interracial couple????   Either way back  to Firefly I go. Don't waste your time with this place.  P.S. THE MUSIC IS TOO LOUD!!!!!

I do have to agree with another poster.  I have a pet peeve against places that don't have a "must come back again" item on their menu.  I crave those goat cheese balls constantly, but this place is no where near me and the friend who invited me there no longer lives nearby either.  I have to say I also miss Baba Reeba's sangria, but remember this places being pretty good....but those goat cheese balls.  Damn them, lol!

I have eaten here twice.  The first time, I went to take advantage of the half off tapas on a Sunday after 8 PM.  I tried the pan fried dates, mac & cheese, butternut squash soup, and the baked cheese.  The mixture of the cream cheese and goat cheese in the baked cheese was a little too overwhelming, so we didn't continue eating it and it was thankfully removed from our bill.  The pan fried dates were pretty much the same as the stuffed dates from Firefly, which is fine by me.  The mac & cheese is better than the one served at Firefly in my opinion and the butternut squash soup was tasty as well.  We ended the meal with the bananas foster dessert and it was A-MAZING.  I'm not even usually a "banana dessert" person, but this was awesome.  The service was great, but we were one of the only groups in the restaurant that night.

The second time I went was on a Saturday night.  It was much more crowded, which was good to see since I wasn't very sure how this place stayed in business based on the volume I saw the first time. Again, I had the pan fried dates and mac & cheese, which were still delicious.  I also tried the sliders and was very satisfied.  For dessert, I had the sweet empanada, which reminded me a lot of a Cuban dessert called pasteles de guayaba.  Overall, both experiences were good ones, but it's also nothing special.  Just glad to have a decent tapas restaurant nearby that's not as trendy and packed as Firefly!
Was there on Friday service  was good we try paella was so good the sangria was also good we  coming back this weekend!

Everything we had here was delicious! 
Clams, ceviche, pequillo peppers, empanadas, beef carpaccio! We loved every bite! Server was really nice and checked at appropriate times for tapas style.

Went last week with a friend from out of town. I had bought a Groupon and was delighted. The service was great. Marco was our waiter and he made all of our selections. The owner came out and also spoke with us since we were new. The food was outstanding and the atmosphere was very nice. The place kept getting busier so I am not alone is saying this is great value for the quality of  food and it is now a regular spot for us.

Not a fan.  This place has a musty smell when you walk in, until you get to the bar. Then, it smells like a dirty bar mat that needs to be cleaned.  The barstools are also very uncomfortable.  Leaving forward and made me feel like I was going to fall out of it.  

It was pretty unpleasant so we left without ordering any food therefore I cannot speak to the food quality.

Yes, Hostess, there is only one of me, dining alone, gasp! Like I don't feel like a loser enough.  Then make sure the rest of the staff ignores me. (Seriously, what's up with such shitty service in this alleged service-oriented town?) That's great. Perhaps find a better way to greet and treat all your guests.

The food I've tried on multiple occasions has been really good. This visit, I would have ordered more if anyone had bothered to check on me. (The brunch selections are more straight outta Waffle House, and the bloody Mary, while nice and spicy, is the size of a Dixie cup.)

Other: The "hummus" is gross... Like pureed northern beans. Too bad sports are blaring from the multiple TVs...ruins the ambiance, no way to escape them. It would also be nice to spruce up your patio with flower boxes instead of ugly banners and signs. I wish there was a more affordable, perhaps half order, of ceviche. And I know this part of town is the end of the universe, but a tapas place that closes at 11? In Barcelona, they wouldn't even think of starting dinner until about then!

Be sure to read the "not recommended" reviews too. I don't think l will be coming back, despite the lack of options down here.

Food is amazing!!!  I would have given this place 5 stars if they had better service,  five of us were there for brunch one of the orders was wrong, the price of one item was more than what the menu said and they didn't split the bill like we asked them to at the beginning.  I would definitely go back because the food amazing.  Food makes up for the poor service.

I'll give this place 2 stars because our server was very nice! Everything we had was disappointing. We did the all you can eat thing because it seemed like the best deal...let me tell you. The albóndigas, you get 1! The beef carpaccio is served with those onion ring things from the can in a little tiny tea plate (okay, if you say that's tapas, then it should at least have more meat or be $10 worth of a plate since that's what it costs by itself), the empanadas were the only thing we liked, mainly the pork one. The vegetarian one was good but the inside was COLD. Got the special of the day which was the stuffed jalapeños which, just like the dates was wrapped in bacon. The bacon tasted like plastic, it was horrible. 
I literally cannot say one good thing about this place other than the sangria and our service were good. 
I would never ever, ever go back and simply cannot understand why they have the rating they have. 
Go to firefly...seriously. Ugh. So sad...$100 later and our date night water.

Their fish tacos & chorizo stuffed mushrooms are my favorite dishes!!! The fish tacos are little breaded fried piece of white fish. The coating is so light and flaky. It has a siracha sour cream sauce with a cabbage slaw. Their French fries are awesome too. The service is always on point but can get a little crowded Friday & Saturday nights.

Tried to find this place for half an hour!  Even after entering the address into the GPS, we were still lost.  After taking several different routes, we eventually arrived and sat down to enjoy the following items:

Sangria, ravioli, meatballs, shrimp skewers, beef skewers and garlic shrimp. Everything was decent.  The owner and waitress returned repeatedly to see if we had enough food.  They were about to close but didn't rush us and made sure we had a pleasurable dining experience.

I'm a huge fan of Tapas,  my wife and I like Firefly a lot so when I got the opportunity to buy a deal on living social for $25 for $50 worth of food, it was a no brainer decision to give it a try.

I hate to be overly critical when I'm getting a discount but here goes anyway :)

The decor was nice, the restaurant has a nice ambiance and overall casual but comfortable feeling.  All of the booths in the restaurant section were full, so my wife and I grabbed a booth like table in the bar as noone was there and it seemed the best choice at the time. It turns out we should have picked a different table as my seat looked right into the kitchen, boxes of soda, the co2 tanks, some dude sitting on a box on his break.  The opening to the kitchen does have some black curtains but they weren't using them and had them tucked back presumably because it was annoying for the workers to walk thru them.  I'm guessing the decorator or owner put those curtains there for a reason, would be nice to see them used.

The menu prices and drinks are all reasonably priced, so no complaints there. They have lots of coupons available including a discount on Yelp, as well as a 3 hour happy hour with most dishes 50% off so if you time it right you get a big bang for you buck.

I ordered the Grilled Octupus and Shrimp Ceviche to get started with while we looked at the rest of the menu for other stuff.   5 minutes later, the Waitress returns with a "I'm sorry we don't have any Grilled Octopus or the Shrimp Ceviche tonight". I'm mildly irritated at this point as:

a.) these are two of my favorite items
b.) I hate it when waitresses don't tell you what they are out of when you sit down.

ok, granted they may be out of Octopus because it is not fresh, etc but they do have plenty of other shrimp dishes on the menu so regarding the shrimp ceviche I think it was more of poor planning or lack of desire to make more.

I asked if there were any more items that they didn't have, and the waitress scampered off to the kitchen again to ask (is it really that hard to know what items you aren't serving tonight???) She mentioned two other items they didn't have one of which was another dish I was interested in, big sigh :(

The food was quite good. My only real complaint was the lack of product knowledge from the waitress. We asked a couple of basic questions like what kind of cheese is on this? etc only to get a blank stare with her picking up the menu to look :)

It's also milldy irritating when they just drop off the food without a brief explanation.  This is XXX, this is YYY.  My wife and I had ordered escargot and they just dumped it off, we thought it was another dish we had ordered because the escargot was prepared in a method we weren't used to (it was good, but would have been nice to know we were eating it :) )

Waitress made two more mistakes regarding the check.  a.) didn't deduct the value of the coupon even though I gave it to her when we sat down, when she adjusted the bill, she gave me the wrong change and I had to point out her mistake to her. Not the end of the world, but I enjoy my evenings out without having to go through small hassles.

Overall, I would give the food a solid 3.5 stars, and the service about a 2.  

I will give this restaurant another try when I'm in the area. Hopefully, they won't be out of the items I want and we will get a better waitress. I will update my rating if I have a better experience next time.

Jason
I don't know how this place got 4/5 stars. We ordered take out. Meat was way over cooked on top of soggy fries. Was hoping it would be a cool local spot but that was the last time.

Omg hands down a new must go to!! I have passed it a million times and tonight wanted something new- wonderful find!! Cute and cozy with excellent service!! I love how everything was explained and all questions answered. We were taught a lot about the culture and how the word tapas came about! Lovely people and amazing food

Awsome joint! Been there plenty of times and never had a bad meal or bad time. They have live music most Friday and Saturday night but u may wana get there early as it fills up pretty fast. They got an all you can eat menu thats fair priced as well as an a'la carte menu thats equally well priced. I recommend the surf and turf with stuffed shrooms!

This a great neighborhood restaurant.  The food is always excellent and the drinks are strong as well.  The only thing I would add to the reviews is to consider the sauce that some of the dishes might be in.  You may want to ask for "light sauce" since some dishes (i.e. mushrooms) tend to be soaked in it.  I usually ask and they comply.

As for the service, it is usually pretty good. I don't know if they have had some turnover recently, but I notice some new faces working there.  But the owner/manager is a really nice guy and does a great job making tasy dishes.

I'd like to point out they have some awesome deals - 4-7pm everyday I believe the tapas at 1/2 off.  At 7pm, it flips and drinks become 1/2 off.  The 1/2 off times definitely make this place a much better deal.  I wouldn't miss it if you live in the South/Southwest Vegas area!

The perfect place for me and lil cub to have a date night. 

From the moment we walked in and were seated we never went without drinks or something to nibble on. This goes a long way in my book.

We had the Mac n cheese, Barcelona fries and the sliders. Followed by the chocolate tres lechwe a la mode. 

Each dish was done perfectly. The Mac n cheese had bacon bits. The fries have Parmesan and garlic and come in a fun retro cone. The sliders are topped with grilled cherry tomatoes. Portions were great and priced very reasonably. 

We'll certainly be eating here again.
Excellent food, the music is nice and good service.  Small tasty plates!

This place has great specials and excellent food! And if the owner is reading our reviews, please introduce "romesco sauce" to your menu! Romesco sauce on tortilla espanola is delicious! On everything really! Otherwise love this place!

Wow! We recently moved to the area. Decided to try this place and boy...it was delicious, fun, live music on Saturdays. We ordered the freshly made humus, the mushrooms are to die for in an amazing gravy...added beef skewers.. very tender and ended tgis thrill with banana foster crepe! Excellent service, delightful atmosphere. We'll be back.

This is one of those reviews that I've had a very hard time writing about because I don't think anything I say will do justice to how much of a good time I had here. 

We showed up for happy hour half off drink and food specials and were seated right away. We must have come at a good time because we really didn't wait long for anything. However, I would say that a great deal of credit should also be given to our server, Marco. He was funny, engaging, and (most importantly) very attentive! 

First, and most importantly: the drinks were deceiving delicious in the sense that they were so tasty that I inhaled three glasses without hesitation only to find that I was pretty ridiculously drunk. The red sangria (arguably the only true sangria) was refreshing and light without being overly sweet or disrespectful to the essence of sangria. We had two pitchers. We also had a pitcher of mojito, which was just as refreshing and tasty (though I favored the sangria). For kicks, I tried a glass of white sangria to Marco's and my husband's chagrin, and while it was delicious, it was nowhere near as awesome as the red (which I refused to admit until now). 

Second most importantly: the food. Delicious. I read a few reviews prior to visiting and was worried about the menu until I realized that the issues were mostly with the marinara sauce dishes and I had no interest in them to begin with. Worries gone! 

Anyway, the food was fantastic. We actually viewed the menu ahead of time and wrote out a list of the items we wanted to eat (for a group of 5). After the first round, we narrowed down to those we wanted seconds of and, voila, we were full and drunk! 

We had:

- Bread Course (complimentary): I think we had a cannelini and honey almond spread. Both were such a great start, but that butter was lardy crack, I swear! I wanted to spread it on everything and make the world a happier place with it. 

- Calamari: Good portion and tasty sauce. I'm partial to the battered calamari over the breaded variety so I was a happy camper. 

- Tortilla Espanola: I know it's just egg and potato, but it's really easy to eff this up. I think it was cooked perfectly (and it got "pretty close" remarks from my husband, the guy who thinks all tapas places not in Spain can't get it right).

- Chicken and Mushroom Soup: Not my call. Soup with sangria? What kind of nut orders that? My sister, that's who. But the soup was good!

- Bacon-Wrapped Dates: Standard fare done well here. We got seconds. 

- Manchego Mac and Cheese: I swoon for cheesy goodness and everyone gobbled theirs up, but I couldn't get seconds because everyone else does not have the same dairy love that I do. 

- Patatas Bravas: Okay, you know how when you eat out and something's supposed to be spicy but, usually, it really isn't? That is not the case. I love heat, but even I caught myself saying, "WOO!" and gulping down sangria. We for sure got seconds!

- Escargot: The sauce, the snails, the veggies... they were soppingly good. The toasted bread was the perfect accompaniment and we all found ourselves wiping the plate clean so as to not waste that delectable sauce. Seconds? Yes!

- Beef Carpaccio: It was dressed so well with the fried onions, balsamic sauce, and cheese. Hell yeah we got seconds! 

- Garlic Shrimp: We got seconds, first, because it only comes in a set of three and we had five people. Secondly, garlic butter sauce, man! 

- Petit Filet: It was like a mini meal of perfectly cooked steak and mashed potatoes. We got seconds. 

- Chocolate Tres Leches: I WANTED to get seconds! 

- Bananas Foster: Thank you, Marco, for this treat! What a satisfying end to such a fulfilling meal! 

All this fun and gorging came out to about $40-$50 a person with tax and tip thanks to the magic that is Happy Hour. 

The only downside is that, for a non-local who comes in from LA, it's a trek to get out here, but sometimes one should venture away from the main haunts. Can't wait to resume the madness!
Decent pricing after 4 pm. Good quality overall. They stepped it up a bit. I'd recommend.

We headed here for dinner the other night because we had a restaurant.com gift certificate. For the food and service, it deserves 1 star. But since the space itself is nice and the happy hour deals are good, I'll bump it to 2 stars.

When we arrived, there was exactly one host / bartender / server - and he may have even been doing some cooking too. So needless to say, service was incredibly slow (despite there only being two other tables of people). And to make it worse, he reminded me of a used car salesman - extremely pushy about getting you to order certain dishes. The table next to us was a mom and young daughter. The mom declined dessert, but the server then proceeded to tell the little girl about the bananas foster crepes and that she must want those. It was all very uncomfortable. (And the same thing happened to us with the one special of the day that he described to us.)

The good thing here is the happy hour deals. When we went, all mojitos were 1/2 half and all seafood and meat tapas were 1/2 off. And that is a great deal. Unfortunately, the mojitos and tapas were downright awful.

We had a mango mojito and blood orange mojito. Neither of us could even stand to drink them. They were very obviously made with a powder mix - and you could see and taste the powder. Ick, icky, ick.

We ordered a a variety of tapas - the special of the day (red peppers with capers and feta), mac 'n' cheese with bacon, tortilla a la espanola, fried dates, etc. We were both incredibly hungry, but we didn't finish any of the dishes. Not only were they disappointing, they were just plain bad.
