The mac 'n' cheese was dried out, had little to no flavor, and practically no bacon. The tortilla espanola was very dried out and way overcooked. These are two tapas that are standard favs of mine at any tapas place, but complete failures here. 

We literally left the food half-eaten on the table and went to another restaurant in the same shopping center.

This is a convenient local spot for us with the variety of tapas. The salami banderas is my fav app dish, if you crave something with a little kick. Usually they have $1 PBR drafts but that was replaced with Rolling Rock not bad but I was trying to get my hipster on.  
        The salami was great and the calamari was good but a little firm. I ordered the pork tacos which were a little more bland this time, should have grabbed the fish tacos which has a spicier sauce and slaw. My buddies ordered the sliders and had no complaints. Service was great this time on a fairly slow day, improvement from past visits. 

         It's a unique place for Southern Highlands with some really great dishes that offer a real variety compared to local bar foods. 4 out of 5.

They have happy hour everyday and all kinds of promotions, they have all the information posted in their website including discount coupons that you can use when you dine in.

In general everything was spectacular!

It is wonderful that they have the tapas happy hour from 4-7.  I especially enjoy the stuffed peppers with black beans and corn sauce.  I am not too impress with their wine selection but you can't beat the half price wine special after 7pm.  The live band is pretty entertaining on Friday but it would be exceptional if they had more of a Cuban flavor.  Overall its a great neighborhood hangout and Melissa the bartender is extremely friendly and outgoing.  Try their cheese plate it's nice with the wine.

Enough people have said... that happy hour is awesome!  The food was great... everything came out fast and I can't wait to go back.  Don't skip out on dessert either... bananas foster was YUM!  We will be back!

Really yummy food here. Fresh ingredients, cooking is just right, not over done, consistently good. 

Thanks, chef! I love your paella!

I, like others, love going to Firefly, but living off Blue Diamond make eating there a bit of a trek.   Though  we found the answer to having our tapas without consuming a half tank of gas when we heard about Barcelong.  We went there for the first time this past Friday night.  We had 7pm reservations and were seated 5 minutes early.  Off to a good start.  The atmosphere is what I call "rustic, trendy".  Great backgound music.  Very upbeat.  Our waiter approached the table and that's where everything went downhill.  He didn't welcome us to the restaurant and didn't introduce himself.  Just asked us what we wanted to drink.  The drinks came quickly, delivered by another member of the wait staff.  It took 20 minutes before our waiter came to take our order.  The restaurant is not very large.  He passed by our table several times and could see, by our closed menus, we were ready to order.  I was starting to take it personally until I saw a man, seated at the table behind us, standing up with his hands on his waist staring in our waiter's direction.  Maybe he had been waiting longer than us.  We finally got to order and the food arrive quickly, again delivered by another member of the wait staff.  The food was awesome!!!  While we were eating, a group seated in another table next to us got into a bit of heated discussion with the same waiter.  They had been sitting for quite awhile without drink orders, let alone food, and wanted to move to the bar.  I couldn't hear all that was said, but I did see the waiter "dismiss" them with a wave of his arm.  More was said, then he ended up taking their drink orders.  It took more time to get a second round of drinks.  (By the way, the sangria was great!!)  He never asked if we wanted dessert.  I wanted to order dessert, but by that time, my fiance was so upset he wanted to get out of there.  We asked for our check.  The waiter brought the check and tossed the check across the table.  He walked away without saying another word.  We are pretty patient diners and have eaten at some of the finest restaurants Las Vegas has to offer.  There were no negative exchanges between us and our waiter.  We smiled the entire time.    I'm not too sure if he was having a bad night or whatever, but it wasn't only us that were far from pleased with the service.  The waiter was flat out rude and indifferent.  Our service at Barcelona was the worst I have ever experienced in this city.  It upsets me, because the food was awesome.  The bus staff, the hostess were great.  Without them, we would have received no service at all.  I would love to go back, but not sure if I want to take a chance getting treated like that again.  Will have to think about it...........

The food gods have delivered the best of best in spanish style Tapas. Monday and Tuesday makes even better with half price bottle wines. The goat cheese balls are my favorite, and ask chef and owner Edgar to make you something special and your taste buds will go nuts
Great food and great prices. I wish the owner had a location in Los Angeles, this was hands down the best tapas restaurant I've ever been to. Tasty dishes, I will return in the future!
Great great food!! Soooo tasty. Ordered the croquetas, the wrapped dates, empenadas, the ribeye bites, and the tres leches chocolate cake. Very good food and service and a nice iberian ambiance!
The food was amazing and the service to match. The staff was attentive and helpful with any questions we had. This place will be taking more of my dollars in the future.

What a wonderful experience we had while visiting from Houston. The food was unique, fresh and delicious.  The homemade sangria, recommended by the hands on owner and chef, Edgar, complimented our tapas to perfection.  It was  difficult not to order a second pitcher. We, of course had to finish with deserts after such an amazing meal.  The only negative is I'm in Houston, and the best tapas I've ever enjoyed are in Las Vegas.  Highly recommend!!

This is my favorite tapas place in town it has the  authentic Spanish dishes my mom prepares. We went there for lunch today our server Victor took the time to explain the dishes they have n favorites ,even knowing it's not our first time . The place is clean very nicely decorated food was always served appetizing n princely right. Awesome sangria, the only  tapas that I will not recommend is the Octopus that we find salty to our taste but the rest of our order was done to perfection Albondigas Tilapia Empanadas.Surely will be back .

The WORSTE restaurant I have ever been to in my life. Not kidding.Terrible service. Messed up our entire order. Keep having to get up and ask for cream for my coffee 15 mins later it was cold another 10 to get it swapped out. Food was gross. I never write reviews, I will be so happy when it goes out of business!!

Food was good, service was good but a little slow and not all of our items came out. Had the Paella that says is good for 2 but really it can feed about 4.  They offer an all you can eat menu for about $25 but it's not on their entire menu. I would come back and do all you can eat just for the al pastor tacos! Yummy!

Ambiance was just OK - there are TVs in the restaurant everywhere. Food was decent - I liked the Ravioli the most, but the meatballs were...very mediocre. I'd go there again if I was hungry, but only if there were specials. Prices not all that bad, though. Decent service, but it seems like they were a bit understaffed.

When we were seated, we started to look at the menus and noticed there was all you can eat for $26.00 and then it was also happy hour. 2 of us at the table decided on all you can eat while the other 5 ordered off of the happy hour menu. It took a few minutes after being seated for our server to come over, we ordered 2 pitchers of sangria as it was half off ($16.00). Then when we placed that order our server said it was better for all of us to order all you can eat because it would be easier on him.. my parents had weight-loss surgery so all you can eat is a waste for them. We started to place our orders and once again he stated it was easier for him to do 5 orders off of the all you can eat menu for my sister and I to start. We were trying to tell him what we wanted but he was constantly assuming what we were going to order and just trying to move very fast. He went down the table for the rest of the orders. Food started to come out and he didn't remember who ordered what so it was a shouting game. Several items that myself and my family ordered never showed. Then when I went to do my 2nd order for All you can eat is when I really started to get frustrated. I wanted to order the bruschetta but not cheese, he then tells me that's no good, and I said well I don't like cheese so that's how I would like it ordered. I then ask what comes on Barcelona fries, he stated "it is the same thing as Burger King" I was very shocked by that comment because once again, I'm paying $26.00 per person for what I would hope to be better quality food than Burger King. I placed my order and we were still missing items other family members had ordered. When he brought out the bruschetta, there was no bread... I asked for bread and he said you don't get that... completely annoyed at this point I see a man walking around that looks like a manager. I explained to him my frustration and all of the missing items. They did their best to get them to us fast however, everyone was over it at that point. He took of 1 item from our bill as a courtesy. Our bill still came to over $200.00 and they added an automatic 20% gratuity which after the service I received, I didn't feel I wanted to pay (but still did). We asked him to split the checks and he said no so we put it all on one card because we were so done at that point. The quality of the food was mediocre at best. I will not be returning to this overpriced tapas restaurant anytime soon.

TWO THUMBS DOWN


Today was the second time I've eaten at Barcelona with my wife.  We live a few blocks down the street so we figured we'd stop in for some lunch.

That was a big mistake.

FOOD: I ordered the NY steak... my wife ordered ceviche.  My steak was so fatty,  I could only eat about half of it.

SERVICE:  After we got the check,  I noticed the server charged us for the carbonated waters we ordered.  I was pretty disappointed so I asked him if that was standard policy.  He was extremely rude and unprofessional.

We will never be back here again and I'll make sure to pass the word along to my friends and family.

I'm going to have to agree with some previous reviews that the best time to go is during happy hour. The tapas available were pretty good and the price was excellent. By the time we left, we were full and the bill wasn't bad.  However, the service was definitely lacking. Our server was a little rude and seemed to only be friendly with other people that showed up and appeared to be regulars. One good thing was that the place wasn't busy when we showed up and the food came out quick.
I love this place. If you like spicy..you have to get the shrimp diablo. Just make sure you dip the free bread in the juice. You will not regret it.
Amazing tasteful Tapas. Also, they have an all you can eat menu. Loved it! Excellent customer service as well. I will definitely be coming back!

I love Barcelona Tapas! What an incredible environment!

They have a delectable variety of vegetarian options on their menu. Also, there are many dishes that you can ask the vegetarian version of (hold the bacon please). I've truly enjoyed every dish that I've ordered. From thier stuffed dates, to the veggie empanadas... There are so many delicious options to choose from.

Their drinks definitely keep me coming back. From margaritas to sangria...
A few drinks, small bites, great service, then top that with an enviroment that makes you feel like you've litteraly stepped into Spain. Barcelona is always a great choice!

Great for date nights, happy hour, lunch, and group outings.

We've been coming here off and on since they opened several years ago. The food quality isn't as good as at first, but average. They have changed the menu up several times, I feel it has been when business is probably slowing. Some options are definitely not what you would find in a traditional tapas place in Spain. Though they seem to try and give the impression with decor, and name, that it would be. 
We came in the other night for the first time in a couple of months, maybe 6 or so. There was a wedding going on, and we should have know this would effect the service in the small place. I personally think it's awesome that a couple wanted to have their renewal ceremony here, but I feel bad how it was handled. Their group was completely crowded in the space provided. When the couple was saying their vows the music kept bumping and other customers literally were irritated with where they were standing and pushing past the couple in the middle of their vows. They were so close to our table my husband could have easily reached over to also hold hands with the happy couple. 
The food was sooooo slow. It trickled in, with no real rhyme or reason. My son and I ordered  several rounds of tapas, and received them, and my husband was still waiting for most of his first order. The service was so slow we eventually just asked for whatever food was ready to just be boxed up to go. It took a while to get a refill on water. They failed to ask how anything was when food actually arrived. The gentleman that sat us at our rable, and brought a foos item or two, was sitting at another table most of the time visiting with some other people. I would think with being so busy it'd be all hands on deck, the entire time.
The positives - there are two, and they are both staff. The young man that was doubling as bus boy and server was hustling the entire time. He was literally running when he was away from the tables to get to the kitchen to keep the food coming to people. No one else was on the floor was working half as hard. We didn't get a chance to speak with him because he was just moving non-stop. I'm tempted to go back and see if he'd want to come work for me with that sense of urgency and hard work. Then the young female waitress that has worked there for years. She is always so nice, and was very apologetic to how slow service was. We've watched her there for years quietly keeping the peace with customers. Like reseating a couple that was in the table the wedding couple was literally pressed against during their vows.
I think if you are going to host this large of a party, then make it a private event, close to the public, and do it right. We were left disappointed and tired after 2 hours of having kids from the wedding group running around our table, and not even getting all our food.

Came here tonight with a group of 5. We were seated right away during happy hour. After looking through their menus our group decided we were going to opt for their AYCE menu. The AYCE menu runs all night where as the happy hour menu is from 4-6. So the group basically tried everything on the menu. 

My personal favorites are the steak skewers seriously order 3 at a time, the fried calamari, the beef empanada, and the chicken tacos. My boyfriend said the ravioli was deliciouso and he meant it since he ordered 4 of them. The rest of the group really enjoyed the sliders and mac and cheese. The albondigas were good as well but they gave one meatball at a time. 

Our least favorites were the chicken soup, the bruschetta, and the stuffed mushroom. The beef carpacio was flavorful but it just isn't as comparable to Brio's. 

The service was so nice and generous. They were constantly checking on us and clearing our plates. The main server was always taking our orders and really patient with us. I will definitely be coming back here and recommending this place!

Brunch - enough said!  Best value as it is all you can eat.  Was a bit disappointed when looking at the menu but after tasting the eggs Benedict and French toast I knew I was experiencing something special!  My friend and I devoured about 5 orders of the bacon wrapped dates and were able to try most of the menu without falling into food coma until we walked out the door.  $20 can go a long way here!

Close to home in Southern Highlands. Was in the mood for tapas and Barcelona Tapas did not disappoint. When you walk in the atmosphere is clean, inviting and the hostess is friendly. I ordered fish tacos, el pastor tacos, and pork empanadas to go. All items were delicious!  The hostess encouraged a return visit for happy hour which I will be doing. The grand sons will love the happy hour appetizer menu. They also have an all you can eat. Something for every body. I highly recommend!
Great local vibe & good variety of drinks. Went in for $1 chicken tacos on Mondays, but ended up enjoying the drinks more

I was looking forward to trying this place since I read about it in the 89148 Magazine back in February.  I love tapas and the menu looked so promising...carpaccio with truffle oil, grilled octopus with a red wine reduction, and chorizo clams in a white wine broth.  My mouth waters just thinking about these dishes and many more on Barcelona's menu, but I'm sad to report that this was one of the most disappointing restaurants I've ever been to!

It just so happens that I recently acquired a coupon to this restaurant and went to it last Friday.  I just want to make it clear that I would have happily tried this place at full price, and the dish I was looking most forward to trying was the carpaccio (you just can't go wrong with raw beef and truffle oil...I'd hope).  My boyfriend and I were seated and greeted promptly.  When the server came over to take our drink order, he looked down at my coupon, took it and went straight to the kitchen.  Being a server for a long time, I could tell he was not happy that we brought this coupon, but I tried to remedy the situation by being extremely nice.  We ordered the carpaccio, pan fried dates, steamed clams, diabla shrimp, grilled octopus, sautéed tilapia, albondigas, and merguez.  After a short while the tapas started coming out, and after delivering the first wave, our server said, "I'm sorry, but the carpaccio is very popular and we are running out of it tonight."  I smiled and said disappointed, "oh really?" and he responded, "yes."  Both my boyfriend and I picked up on his wording, but we did not confront him about it.  It is my strong belief that they had enough carpaccio for AT LEAST another order, but they didn't want to waste it on a table with a coupon!  As the night progressed our server grew increasingly more impatient and annoyed with our presence.  When we got our check he had manually written in an 18% tip...on a table for 2, and I always automatically tip 20% (even when the service is bad)!  With a coupon or something comped, I usually tip much more because that's what fellow service industry workers do...(can you tell how livid I am?)  Unfortunately, I wish I could say that only the service was sub par, but the food ranged from ok to not even edible.

Pan Fried Dates- This was the best dish we had from Barcelona.  The bacon was cooked well, all of the textures were spot on, and they had a nice savory sweet taste.  However, the red wine reduction was way too thin, the blue cheese crumbles were on the stingy side, and Firefly's are much better.

Steamed Clams- The clams were cooked well, but the chorizo was very dry.  The broth also needed more seasoning (this is a common theme).

Diabla Shrimp- I liked this, but again, it was not as good as Firefly's.  A nice spicy sweet sauce with shrimp, but the sauce was a little too thin.

Grilled Octopus- This just lacked seasoning.  The octopus was a pretty good texture, not too chewy, but the flavor was bland.  For good grilled octopus, try Olives in the Bellagio.

Sauteed Tilapia- Completely inedible!  I'm not sure if the kitchen just didn't care or if they genuinely made a mistake, but the outside of the fish was mushy and the inside was raw.  I've never seen fish this texture before, and I honestly can't think of how it happened.

Albondigas- Meatballs in marinara with melted mozzarella on top.  These were so dry we drenched each bite in the marinara.

Merguez- A spicy lamb sausage served over roasted red pepper couscous.  The sausage was dry and not very spicy.  The couscous was a little wet, but it had a good flavor.

The one good thing about our experience was that the man refilling our drinks was extremely friendly!  He never let a drink go empty and explained they have live music some nights.  I really wish the food had been better so I could give this place a second chance.

My favorite little spot in Southern Highlands. There happy hour prices have extended from 4-7pm they also have an amazing all you can eat for 18.99.

I love the beef empanadas, beef carpaccio and chicken skewers. 

This place makes you feel like you're in Barcelona with the decor and sangrias. 

Great place to dine and very Cozy!

Went here for the first time tonight to celebrate a Birthday. We got the $25 all you can eat and every single dish that came out was amazing. We had the chicken skewers, calamari, dates, stuffed artichokes etc.. It was all amazing!! To top it or was the delicious Sangria!! Great place and ambiance!! Will be back!

I went to this place hoping for some wonderful tasty taps but I was a but disappointed only because it seems to me like they use the same sauce on most of there dishes. I had order the meatballs and stuffed mushrooms and my hubby order the mussels and they all tasted very similar with the same mild red sauce. It was mediocre food but a great happy hour price. We also had the red sangria I strongly suggest not to order it here its like red cheap wine with some simple syrup and fruit juice. But food was prompt and service was on point .

Came here with my roommate for lunch and it was amazing! Our server was extremely friendly and helpful since it was our first time. We basically ordered two of everything on the ayce menu. I freaking love how small the portions are. It really let's you try everything. My absolute favorites were the little salami banderas and beef carpaccio. Will definitely be back! Awesome service from victor. Thank you!

What a gem! Everything we had was fantastic, it's hard to pick a favorite.  We did the all you can eat and had House salad, albondigas, steak skewer, dates, chicken piccata, mushrooms, chicken skewer, salami and soup.  It takes getting used to how tapas work, but we had so much fun.  The mango margarita and sangria were great.  Topped it off with gelato and flan.  The service was top notch, our waiter was super nice and helpful with selections. Ambience is cozy and romantic. Love this place and can't wait to go back.

I'm torn on this one.

We started out with one waiter who took our order and completely disappeared. Eventually another waiter took over and he was a sweetheart. Very attentive and called us "my friends" every chance he got.

I had a white wine sangria which was pretty low on alcohol. I had 2 of them and didn't even have a buzz.

In regards to food, everything was just so-so. The stuffed dates were delcious, as was the complimentary bread with hummus and mystery spread. What IS that stuff? Whatever it was, it was addictive.

Albondigas were okay, but they were served with a marinara sauce which I've never seen in a Spanish restaurant or on this type of dish. The chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms were served the same way. They had a mealy texture, as I believe the meat was finely ground or shredded. Weird.

The fried goat cheese was WAY too rich. It could have used more honey or balsamic to offset the cheese.

Macaroni and cheese was bland and unimpressive.

I'd highly recommend the surf and turf platter with shrimp, chorizo and steak. It was served with some amazing mashed potatoes and covered in a chimichurri that was delicious.

All in all, I'll definitely be back because tapas can be hit or miss and there's a ton more stuff to try.

I absolutely love this place! Was in the mood for a Tapas restaurant and found this one on Yelp and luckily had very good reviews. 
I got there in time for their Happy Hour menu and was able to select some good items : Chicken and Rice soup, Beef carpaccio, Chicken Empanadas. I liked every single thing, Empanadas we're so-so. I ordered their Barcelona fries, as well as their Salami Bandera and lastly their Banana Foster for dessert. This is my new favorite place! Also, when you check in with Yelp you get a free Sangria ( 1 per table only). Come check out this Spanish Tapas place, Lorena is the best waitress!!!
One of my favorite places to eat near home. The food is cheap, simple yet delicious, the staff are all friendly and efficient, and their Sangrias are so good.

Man, I don't even know what to think of this place. So many mixed signals. The place from afar is cheap looking, when you go inside it's a restaurant style place but clearly not the restaurant feel. There was a bar but there was only one guy running the whole place & the cook. The guy barley spoke English, I really don't care but he seemed to be annoyed he couldn't explain things well. Was super unprofessional & I'm really curious to how this place does on a busy night... If it ever gets packed. Food was good, not worth coming back for. Not sure how long this place has been standing but I see potential in it, if they got employees that cared & were positive & seemed like they wanted to be there.

I am horrified by the service I received here on Labor Day weekend. The young, brunette, female bartender ignored us at the hightop table 3 times and no one else came over to us so we could even express our frustration, so we had to call and complain after we left. The only reason I didn't give 2 stars is because Melissa the bartender is so sweet and the food/sangria is pretty decent on my previous visits. Overall if Melissa is not working and I'm not at the bar, I won't come back here. Skip it and go to Firefly.

This place does not disappoint! It was our first time eating here. The parents did all you can eat, and we did entree styles. They were very accommodating with my boyfriends allergies. Our waitress Cynthia was absolutely amazing. We will definitely be back here seeing since we live 5 minutes away!

Tried this place on a whim....and what a treat....Calamari, Chicken Piccata, Empanadas and the albondigas...Everything amazing. Live in Sacramento...will definitely be back next time in Vegas.  Cynthia was awesome!!!

Barcelona was probably one of the biggest surprises of my trip to Vegas. It wasn't my favourite restaurant we went to by any means but it was the one I had the most hesitations about and was happily proven wrong.

My friend and I arrived in Vegas quite late and decided to have dinner somewhere close to our off-strip hotel. We had looked up another restaurant in this strip mall but when we arrived, we decided that Barcelona looked more our style. Ok fine! I was sucked in by the "All you can eat tapas" sign!

At first I found the menu somewhat overwhelming. It is big and highly varied. Luckily margaritas were on special so one decision was easy. My friend and I ended up sharing a number of items off the vegetarian section: veggie empanadas, the Barcelona salad, raviolis, and these adorable parmesan nests that were on special. We also finished our meal with a piece of chocolate cake. Everything was waaaay better than expected. I wish I remembered what the parmesan nests were called because they were unreal.

The portions were pretty generous so this was more than enough for us since we weren't particularly hungry. Personally I don't think I'd bother with the all you can eat option unless it's on special. The prices were already pretty reasonable.

Overall I was very pleased with my visit to Barcelona. The had live music which was a lovely touch and fantastic service. This is the perfect place if you want something more casual with great food. It also seemed like a nice place for families without feeling like a "family restaurant".  Unfortunately I don't live in Vegas so it will be a long time before my next visit but I would definitely come back if I could!

Barcelona tapas is still good and still in the southern highlands plaza all these years. I've done the AYCE menu and it is amazing. The beef and chicken skewers are hearty with flavor and the bacon wrapped dates are always good. I always get an order of either mojoto or white sangria while coming to this establishment.

Their happy hour is now only 4-6 so be aware of that.

We went on a Saturday for happy hour and had a really good time.  Its a small place and I believe the entire staff are owners or family members so they're very attentive.

There were 6 of us and we each had at least 2 glasses of sangria and ordered about 10 different items, yet the bill was only $91.  

Between the group we tried the calamari, meatballs, chicken piccata, chicken empenadas, stuffed mushrooms, and the banana crepe thing for dessert.  We all really enjoyed everything.  It isn't necessarily 5 star food but no one was unhappy with anything we received (not easy to do with 6 women at the table).

I can't speak for regular menu items but its a really nice place for happy hour.

And the sangria is *really* good.

AYCE Tapas are a must.

Barcelona has really stepped their game with adding "all you can eat" to their menu. The wait staff is very attentive and accommodating. They always made sure our drinks were topped off and all our ACYE orders were placed. The atmosphere is very relaxed. My favorite picks from them would have to be their empanadas, chicken skewers, and couscous.

Experience was just bad. We came for lunch, food was terrible, nothing cooked , dates overfried, mashed potatoes frozen , bruschetta stuff just from the fridge, steak skewers all messy. Very bad dining experience.

I've been here several times the food and service are always been very good. The bacon wrapped dates and tacos al pastor were really good. Definitely take the staffs recommendations on what to order.  Everything they've recommended was really good.

Very cute inside & was promising based on other reviews I read. Was totally disappointed!  Sat outside in uncomfortable chairs because the live music was much too loud.  Then the food... After waitress first gave our food to another table then brought it to us, we received room temperature over cooked chorizo in a abundance of salty otherwise sauce.  Then we got our $22 fish dish which tasted like it was made with a packaged Bouillon. Very salty & otherwise bland again.  Finally we got the white fish with capers which was pretty good, but so turned off by this point, it was not enough to make me want to return. The drink was not fresh as advertised either.  I really can't believe this place has any good reviews. Firefly has always been much better in my experience.

The place is small and the dishes are alright. If you're looking for a good neighborhood tapas restaurant then this place is THE place. I like that it's nestled close to home (Southern Highlands). They recently added an AYCE menu but be advised that only certain dishes from their full menu are available for AYCE. 

My favorites here are the dates of course (Firefly ones are still better but it's a good substitute if you're craving), the albondingas and the empanadas. They do have a full bar with gaming, which is a nice surprise, and the sangria is decent. 

Overall, for my neighborhood bar, it's quite alright! If you live near it I say most definitely try it, but if you're going to drive, there are much better tapas restaurants in the valley that are comparable in price.
Great sangria...tapas menu has a lot of variety...make sure to check out the coupon on their website, $25 off my meal

Probably one of the most amazing restaurants I've been to in a long time. 

Starting with the service:

1) Server victor was amazing! Super nice had some great recommendations. Everything he recommended was delicious. 

2) the chef was tremendously nice as well he greeted us made sure we were satisfied with our meal. They also presented us with the happy hour menu which was great prices. 

I will be back and will be recommending all family members n co-workers. 

If your considering coming here don't hesitate servers, owners, chef rock a must visit restaurant!!!

I was devastated last night to see the doors shuttered and the sinage gone. I NEED their food, dang it!
I spent all morning trying to track down Chef Edgar. Turns out that there is a Barcelona at the Artisan Hotel on Sahara.
Same basic menu.
 Am soooo going to visit next week. They are also on Open Table, so I can get reservation points.

Visiting Vegas for a softball tournament, not very hungry, so I look for a Tapas place on Yelp. Barcelona came up, we tried it out and we were very happy we did! We tried the Al Pastor tacos (they were my favorite!), the chicken empanadas (delicious) and the shrimp ceviche (my husband loved it). I would recommend this place to anyone!!

Disappointed how greasy all the food was especially the dates. Also the waiter with the black eyeglasses, tall was a tad creepy. He came over and counted his money in tips at our table while we were eating.

Had an amazing lunch here. Definitely worth it! It's nice chill place to eat some tapas. Service is great! 

Shrimp ceviche 10/10
Papas bravas 8/10
Beef carpachio. 10/10
Calamari 10/10
Croquetas  10/10

Loved it! I will be coming back for sure!

Tried this restaurant for the first time and had a great dinner. Nice, little spot in a neighborhood shopping center, small bar area with a couple TV's for viewing. Staff was very friendly and attentive and the chef came out to see how we were enjoying our meal. The food was terrific. Bacon Wrapped Dates in a Merlot Reduction, Lamb Chops, Filet Mignon Medallions, Mac & Cheese with Bacon, Camarones El Diablo, Albóndigas, all excellent and nice portions. They offer an 'All You Can Eat' menu if you like (not all menu selections are on the All You Can Eat menu) and have a daily Happy Hour. We look forward to visiting them in the future.

it was a longest way to find the great food for me i took this restaurant forget about the rating and listen to my friend's recomendation. he was dead right, when we reach the place late night, it was pretty busy and great live music was playing by a solo gutarist in the corner. we sat by the bar and Moolisa the bartende was our waitress and she was lots of fun and energy for the place. We pick all our food under her rcomendation and the frist we had the short rib plate was so delicious. then she brought the sousage on the stick thing is little sweet but we enjoyed it too. the best plate was the PORK... it was so good and tasty and the meet was melting our mouth without having a bite. 
Also the spicy shrimps was the bomb and, the desret was very tempting.... highly recomended.!!

I'm not sure why they call themselves barcelona, not very authetic spanish cooking. but the tapas are good. they could have a bigger selection of tapas. service was excelant. check them out on half price night!!! And try the Sangrias, free samples are available...

I've had an overall good experience at this restaurant. I've been here a few times and the customer service is always great. I really like the small plates, since I don't eat much, and you can order several different things to try. The prices are all decent, which is rare for Las Vegas. A couple times I've been here I've been unimpressed with the food, however most of the time it's good. The Carne Asada wasn't traditional, and it was made with french fires so it wasn't very enjoyable. The Calamari tasted a little bland, however I absolutely love their filet mignon, surf and turf, and rib eye bites. They have lots of flavor and I love the sauce they use. The atmosphere is also really nice, it's quiet and romantic on weeknights but great for social groups on the weekends. This restaurant also offers 1000 points on OpenTable sometimes which is awesome.

This place is over rated! $$ my boto! It should really be a $$$ to relate to the portions you get. 

I've been to tapas around the country and this one is not cheap and food is ok. However, it's one of only a few in Vegas so they have the market cornered.

I rather go to Hawaiian BBQ which is a true $-$$. Probably only worth it during happy hour on Fridays.
Happy hour was great! And the fried goat cheese is a must have. Servers were really nice and service was speedy. Meatballs were dry and not flavorful

I really wanted to like this place... The good food was great and the bad food was horrid. If I ever go back I will only order the sangria and beef carpaccio. All of the grilled meat was tough and dry. So steer clear of the skewers or burgers. 

We ordered the sliders and they brought out a plate with only dry over cooked meat and stale toasted buns. When we asked the server where everything else was, he said that they thought the kids wouldn't like the aioli and pickles (when we didn't order them for the kids).  And that he had never seen this come with fries, and didn't know why it said that on the menu. Then continued to ask if we would like to purchase a side of fries. So we did and those were good. 

We were extremely disappointed after seeing such good reviews.

Barcelona' s a cute tapas joint in a S.Highlands strip mall. Atmosphere is lively, albeit crowded and loud at points. We rolled in for our girl's b-day and were immediately in the mood after we saw the Mojito pitchers waiting for us on the table. Unfortunately, service was substantially lacking though, after we asked for more atencion (Spanish will get you places here!), our server turned from zero to hero (special note: we were a group of 15 -- not sure about the hero factor had we been 2 for dinner.) Menu stars: the grilled octopus and the spicy shrimp (careful, these really are caliente). Menu duds: potato bravas (cannot hold a candle to Julian Serrano -- see my previous review), and the Piquillo peppers (these may have been great had they been served hot). I honestly don't know what else we ordered because the servers brought out the wrong dishes a few times throughout dinner. Maybe the answer is: Go but avoid noshing on Saturday evenings, which seems to be THE night here.
The worst quality food at very high prices. Was very sick the next day after eating here.
Great place with great service.  A good selection of vegetarian foods.  The veggie empanadas are my favorites.  I have done the all you can eat.  Great value.

My hubby and I enjoy coming here. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. The food is great with lots of selection. They have an incredible happy hour with pitchers of sangria for cheap and delicious tapas. I love that it is so close to where we live. I enjoy the small quiet atmosphere, it's perfect for date night!

Found this place by luck and it was phenomenal!!! A lucky girl like me happened to come here on a Monday and do the ALL YOU CAN EAT on a Monday. They offer a glass of Red or White Sangria, all you can eat tapas, and dessert for $18.99. Yassss I'll be coming back again!!! I'm not quite certain but I think this place has the best ravioli I have ever tasted. My friend and I ordered way too much food, worth every calorie ;)

The Get yourselves a bottle of the Tempranillo-Shiraz blend and enjoy The carpaccio, the mussels , the empanadas. All Yummy yummy yummy!!!! Victor, our server this time around, was awesome, he was attentive, kept our glasses full! So, to sum up, FIVE STARS for being in Las Vegas. Please come and enjoy some great Spanish food.
Love the tapas here.  Sometimes they gave the special of the day. Happy hour is 4p-6p daily. Food here is great!

I bought a coupon off Living Social and was excited because they're almost identical to Firefly.

We got seated right away but waited for our waitress. Though they weren't busy, we had a hard time finding her. 

First they start you off with complimentary bread and butter. Yum! Though it didn't compare to Firefly, that didn't hold me back.

We ordered :
Pan fried dates, I didn't enjoy these better than Firefly but they were nonetheless still very good. We knew we'd order more of these babies.

Garlic shrimp, very tasty. The sauce had a lot of flavor, I love garlic, so this was an easy like. It only came with three skewers and with so much goodiness in that dish, we had to help ourselves to seconds.. even thirds!

Beef carpaccio, it was my first time trying it and I was not disappointed! The sauce was so flavorful and the crispy onions were a great touch! I just wished I was served this first so I could have had room for seconds.

Beef sliders, I'm not a big fan of burgers but from what my brother said, it was bomb . com. And I loved how they served him ketchup in almost like Aladdin's genie lamp. So cute. Their thin fries were pretty good also, it had a nice crunch to it.

Manchego mac&cheese, definitely enjoyed this one a lot better than Firefly's, the taste was spot on. My boyfriend even enjoyed it, so big thumbs up for BT&B!

Paella, it was okay, I just didn't like having big, uncut lumps of chicken in there. They definitely weren't bite size but the flavors were there, rice was just a bit undercooked.

It's a lot more brighter and roomier than Firefly, that was a plus for me. Because I love being able to tell what the color of my food really looks like. Our waitress just pretty much just wasn't great. Know how to bring hot dishes hot, not lukewarm and she should try and learn the menu.. just sayin'.

Our family just had dinner there and it was terrific. 
 
We had a chance to meet the owner and he was so gracious. The food was amazing. We went during happy hour and saved half off our bill. The best tapas we tasted were the manchego and serrano cheese platter, the beef sliders, the pan fried dates wrapped in bacon, and the wonderful, tasty desserts...chocolate tres leche and a banana foster's which was to die for. Overall, this restaurant deserves a 5 stars due to the attentive service, the delious sangria and the wonderful, tasty tapas.

AYCE Mondays is an incredible deal.  We were a party of 16 with various needs, some vegetarians as well.  Arranged it all two weeks b4 the event including the tapas we wished to be served at each table.  Everything went without a hitch!  Service was flawless and the food was beloved by all including fussy kids, gram, and the whole crowd.  Thanks for making us such a great party!  A wonderful asset of Southern Highlands...

ive been here twice and have been disappointed both times. its nice that its just down the street in southern highlands but not even worth it at all.
the decor of theplace at least is cute. lots of spanish style memorabilias. but the food was just not up to par. 
 
the albondigas (meatballs) were so dry and the marinara sauce was not even good enough to dip it in.
their signature barcelona fries were old. not crispy and fresh at all.
the stuffed ushrooms were acceptable. the stuffed dates were extremely oily, but then again all their dishes seemed to be oily. 
the place has a good vibe and atmosphere. it just needs better cooks and chefs because the food seriously needs improvement.

Just left this place and I am stuffed! My friends and I went for the AYCE tapas. This particular menu had 23 total items, if I remember correctly. We ordered one of everything for each person and a total of 17 of them came out before we tapped out. We were not disappointed, just extremely full. Apparently that's never been done before and the server asked if he could take our picture! The only thing was, everything came out very close together, leaving some plates to get cold, unfortunately.
Also, the jalapeño mango margarita, delicious. The mild has a little bit of spice, but a lot of flavor. However, it was a little bit syrup-y.
All in all, great experience and great food.
Jesus & Luis was awesome!!! We went back for 2nds and 3rds. Fish picattas was delicious. Cozy surrounding! Loving their menu for happy hour!

went in on a wednesday night around 8pm. got seated right away and had Matt as our server. (he was great. very nice and recommended one of our desserts that we loved.) the free bread, spicy butter, and hummus they give you are very tasty but do not fill up on them. the tapas were delicious. the fried calamari was some of the best i had in vegas, the lamp chops melted in my mouth, and the stuffed peppers were just what i was craving. the desserts we got were the chocolate tres leches a la mode and the empanada. both amazing. Matt told us about the seasonal specials they will be having weekly and i know my boyfriend and i will be returning asap.

I was very disappointed on my last visit here, which was last night (a Tuesday evening), around 8:30 pm. I was alone, and waiting for my husband to come join me after work, so I sat at a small table in the bar area. First of all, I ordered a glass of wine. Now, at this point, they usually bring you bread with honey butter and some other delicious spread first. This time they did not. They brought me my first tapas entree before I ever got any bread...and I had to ASK for the bread. I don't like the AYCE menu as well as I like the a LA carte menu, so that's what I ordered from. I have always loved the lamb chops in the past. Last night, the lamb chops were pretty good,  but there was no feta cheese at all in the accompanying couscous, so it did not have as good a flavor as it usually does. It's just not the same without the feta. I also ordered the mussels, which I remembered before as being really large and swimming in a delicious broth. This time they were much smaller and very dried out. There was barely a smidgeon of dried up sauce in the middle of each one, so they didn't have much flavor either. No broth at all. They were just placed on a plate around a small pile of lettuce with a very bland dressing on it...not at all the tasty dish I remembered from before! This place must be under new management or new ownership, I'm guessing, because nothing was as tastey as it was on previous visits! I decided to try something new, so I ordered Carne asada which was decent, but not good enough to make up for the rest of the disappointing experience. Overall, just very bland and boring flavors. We could have eaten more, but we didn't want to risk further disappointment, so we did not order anything else. 3 small tapas plates and a glass of pinot grigio... almost $50. We were hungry again in an hour.

Our first visit here and we loved it! The waitress was fantastic, the food was wonderful. We came for happy hour and to watch football. It was perfect. 

It was also 4:30 on a Sunday and very few patrons besides ourselves. So that was actually a good thing for us. Less "peopley".

I've been to Barcelona a few times, and it's always a pleasant experience. Most recently I went with my boyfriend and mom on a Friday night and was surprised at how busy it was. They offered us a table between two large parties but noted it would probably be cramped. Another server rushed to make a table by the bar that worked out perfectly. There was live music playing from the corner but from where we were sitting it wasn't too loud to talk to each other. 

I think it's brilliant that they have an all you can eat menu. However, it's pretty hard to eat $25 worth of tapas per person. We ordered the tomato bruschetta, patatas bravas, mac and cheese, pork empanadas, croquettes, al pastor tacos, and dates, as well as two martinis and four beers and it came out to $100. All you can eat would have been $75 off the bat and I think with drinks and tax it would have been more than $100. If you want to relax and share plates and not get too full I don't see a reason to do the AYCE. Lunch prices do seem more justifiable though.

My favorite of the dishes we ordered was the patatas bravas and tacos al pastor. The patatas bravas were smaller pieces than I've had before, allowing each bit to be crispy. It also wasn't smothered in cheese which was nice, and it had a great saltiness to it. The tacos al pastor meat was similarly cut up small and super crispy. I did taste a few bits of pineapple but could have used a little more. Surprisingly my least favorite was the mac and cheese. It had a smoky flavor to it and the side of bacon looked and tasted like bacon bits. The tomato bruschetta and empanadas were solid choices, not necessarily mind blowing. The dates are a must always. 

The service was wonderful here. It feels like a family environment and I'm glad to see that it was so full the night we went in. Even though it's further from my house I'd have to say I prefer Barcelona to Firefly. I definitely want to check out the lunch AYCE sometime soon.

I wanted to venture off and try something different. The service was pretty bad for my group. Every time the guy came over he seemed annoyed. We still were nice and even gave him a tip. The sangria I had was the best part of the night. The food was nothing that I can remember sadly.
Amazing tapas! We go in frequently for dinner and the staff is always happy to see us, friendly and attentive. The food is wonderful. Very fresh, and homemade. Go, you will not regret it!

I've been to Barcelona a couple times. Once with my mother when she was in town and a couple times with the sig other. I was skeptical it could be any better than firefly, but its in comparisons in many aspects. Obviously the location is out of the way for most people in the metro (really only about 10-12 mins from the strip area), but it's 2 mins away from my house, so when we're in the mood for some tapas and a few glasses of sangria this is my/our spot.

I learned about pan fried dates a couple years ago at the aforementioned competitor, and in my opinion they are just as good or probably better at Barcelona. They definitely came out faster at Barcelona, probably because they're not normally as busy. All of the other food that we've chosen have been pretty good as well. My girl got the empanadas one time, and she said they were just ok. 
We love the bread and fixins they bring out with the waters.
The service has been above average-really good every time we've been. And from what I read, I need to check out the website for the specials.
Pretty tough to beat the prices and location for me. My experiences here have been above average so I have to give them a solid 4 stars.
We'll definitely be back for some sliders, fries, mac and cheese, and dates!

It is a mediocre local tapas restaurant. Great happy hour deals but at the same time, the quality of their food doesn't really make me want to pay full price. However, we do happily go there for happy hour. 

Please don't get me wrong. Certain things are good such as their octopus dish, tilapia meuniere and etc. If you approach this establishment as a bar with relatively good food rather than an authentic true Spanish tapas restaurant, then you would enjoy this place. I really enjoyed passion fruit mojito! 

It's always great to see a neighborhood restaurant doing well.
The happy hour here is amazing you can't get any cheeper .. Service here is great a small town feel .. I would highly recommend this for all.
I LOVE this restaurant! The food is fantastic (the dates and paella are amazing) and the staff is SO nice! I need to go here more often!

This place is delicious! My Bestfriend and I came here one night and the server was so helpful! We got the all you can eat and it was so worth it, It's 22 dollars for dinner! I loved the fried goat cheese balls that the server recommended. I LOVED the chicken and shrimp skewers! I would also recommend the croquettas! Our server was amazing he was very attentive and quick and the place is very clean which is a super plus for me!
We love this place.  The atmosphere is quiet and relaxed.  The tapas are so good and the sangrias are amazing.

On our first visit, we tried the different tapas' on their happy hour menu and were not really impressed.

We came back last Sunday since I was craving for Paellla and it was a wonderful surprise that the food quality was totally different. We ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo and Brochettas De Pollo and they were all good. The Camarones Al Ajillo I say is a must try. My bf almost licked the plate!

We will be back!

Great tapas restaurant!  We especially love: bacon wrapped dates, eggplant cannelloni, lamb chops, spinach salad, sausage, and mushrooms.  Each time we go, we try to get something new to try and we have yet to be disappointed.  The service is average - orders are taken on time, food is promptly delivered and is correct, and check comes at appropriate time - but the service lacks personality and friendliness.  The owner/manager does come around and he is upbeat and friendly, but his wait staff could improve in that area.  We eat there pretty often and most servers would already know us by name, but not here.  Not a big deal, though.  This is a fun place to go with your entire family, just the girls, just the guys, with a big group, or on a date night.  There is a kids menu and kids high-chairs if needed.  Be sure to stop in when it's 50% off food or 50% off drinks.

I'm loving the local watering hole. Happy hour here rivals Brio but this is more intimate. Sit at the bar and do some shots with the bartender. Good times all around. The boquerones and the serrano ham and cheese platter are staples for me. Simple food to accompany a few cocktails is all I need.

I have a hard time believing any negative reviews about the food. When this place first opened, I did find it a little bland but that was years ago. Over the last few years the food has been top notch. I used to drive half way across town to Firefly but Barcelona has kept me close to home and I am so happy they are here in Southern Highlands. The staff has always been friendly, the ownership is great  and caring. I kind of wish only sports bars had TV s as I find those distracting and that they take away from the atmosphere but that's not isolated to this place. I go here often and highly recommend it.

Yum! Stopped in today after finding this restaurant on Yelp. We had the Monday special.... $18.99 all you can eat Tapas that included dessert (though some Yelpers say their $18.99 lunch included a  glass of sangria we were told it wasn't included at this price boohoo! I was disappointed). There was plenty to choose from and just about  everything was very appealing to us.  Our server (I wish I could remember his name Monday around 1:30) was awesome. Being new to tapas he told us to start with about 5  items (each) which we did and then ordered more from there. It was the perfect advice and we ate everything. I liked everything I ordered, chicken tacos, ham and cheese croquettes, chicken piccata, salad, steak skewers, meatballs, chicken soup, stuffed mushrooms and cheesecake for dessert. My husband absolutely loved the salami banderas,  white fish piccata as well as the flan! The service was excellent. Our drinks were constantly refilled and food was nicely timed. When we asked our server about a menu item he politely and happily explained it to us. He was the only waiter and handled the many tables and front desk very efficiently. We will return to try out there regular menu.

I'm definitely a fan!  I have mixed emotions about tapas, just because I've been programmed from a young age to appreciate large portions and having small plates with small portions (though plentiful) messes with my head :)  I also think I end up spending more that way...but I think that speaks more to my issues than to Barcelona.

First off, I've passed this place a million times and never eaten here.  It's conveniently located and easy to find in the Smith's shopping center.  It's much bigger inside than I imagined!  I mean, it's a modest size, but I pictured it much smaller.  We went in the late afternoon on a Saturday and it wasn't too busy.  We were seated and proceeded to order off the Happy Hour menu (half off).  Also, by checking in on Yelp, you get a free drink!  Awesome!

My friend and I ordered about 7 happy hour tapas...mac n cheese, escargot, some kind of chicken dish, eggplant dish, mushroom dish...and a few other things I can't remember.  Everything was REALLY good!  Drinkwise, we went with the sangria and mojitos.  I think I enjoyed the mojito more, but both were pretty good.

All in all, I don't have any complaints.  Our server was so nice and very attentive.  This place had a very comfortable and homey feel to it.  Everything seemed clean and in its place.  I do have to reinforce...tapas DO add up, especially the way my friend and I eat, so I probably would not come at any other time slot besides happy hour which is 4-7p Sun-Thurs and 4-6p Fri-Sat.

Sorry if I sound too negative but this place is average at best.. The flavors are a tad dull and the ingredients taste as if they were frozen and put on your plate.. I live near the city of sf and had tapas at the Arya and this place was far below the quality..hint this place was dead Saturday night... My wife and I were the only one eating there!
Average.  Nothing incredibly noteworthy, but nothing terrible at the same time.  Only way I would go backwoods be to accompany friends for drinks...  Otherwise I would seek out other accommodations.

The quality of staff here is unsurmountable.  
This place has a lovely atmosphere, I can take any number of my colleagues here and have an impeccable time. 
The quality and flavors of the food have never let me down in the 20+ times I have dined here.
Their home made sangria is to die for, I always chose the red.
During happy hour is my favorite time to go as it is lively inside yet still we have our personal space. 
I look forward to more locations opening in town.  
Favorite dish has to be pan fried dates and absolutely the sauteed mushrooms. (Even if you dont like mushrooms you MUST try these!)

Namaste'
The Menu looked impressive and the food presentation was fantastic and very delicious! Great service from our server, Nancy.
Wow, what a colossal disappointment and waste of time and money not to mention appetite. For anyone that dares to even compare this to FireFly in a positive way must have been drunk on margaritas.

My husband and I were craving empanada. So we googled where to find some in the valley and found this gem. It was our first tapas experience and it was delicious. We ordered beef and pork empanadas, steak skewers and tacos al pastor. The beef empanadas were very flavorful. We also got the free sangria with a check in. We had a white sangria and red. Luis our waiter was so friendly and welcoming. We will definitely be back! Oh I also got the bread pudding and I literally could have ate 10 of those. So yummy!!
Great food! The bacon dates are my favorite.  Recently tried the paella and it was amazing. So yum!

This place is in the boonies, but I will drive the 40 minutes it takes me to get here because 1. There are no hipsters who think that Firefly is the best ever and 2. The food is fresh, flavorful, and masterfully done. Don't let the bar appearance fool you. This place is golden.

Pan Fried Dates - amazing texture and flavor combination. Best damn dates ever. I ordered this twice in one visit.

Grilled Artichokes - very tender. Excellent flavor.

Stuffed Mushrooms - has a great kick. Delicious.

Garlic Shrimp - very flavorful. The garlic was generous but not overpowering. The shrimp was perfectly done and tender.

Steak Skewers - the only thing I didn't like. There was something about the flavor of the meat itself - gamey almost. Perfectly cooked, however. My mum devoured these.

Bananas Foster Crepes - delicious and tastes homemade. My mum makes killer bananas foster at home, and this lived up to our lofty expectations.

White Sangria - light, refreshing, and super delicious. I'm really glad we didn't order the pitcher. As a super lightweight, that would not have ended well.

"I will be back."
-Arnold

I just called to make a reservation for Christmas Eve and I had to repeat my reservation 5 times due to the fact that the man who answered the phone had very broken English. I completely understand and I am sensitive to the fact that most of us are bilingual nowadays. However, when in a business establishment especially over the phone is it too much to ask that the person taking the reservation not only listen to the customer's request but also understand it?! At first he thought I wanted it for this evening, then Christmas Day, and then kept writing down the wrong phone number, the whole experience just on the phone was such a turn off that I will be cancelling the reservation to go somewhere else. Sad, especially being that I can literally walk there from my house!

I usually get the food to go which is great but I went in for the first time last night ... Most of the food was really really good! Including, talapia, sliders, and most
Of the stuff off of the all you can eat menu was really nice. (All you can eat for 22$, nice deal I believe)  I got a free glass of sangria for my check in, which was nice but it was basically just iced red wine with some chopped fruit on top. Not a true sangria but I still drank it lol. I also got the pomegranate passion mojito which was ok mostly syrup and ice. Soooo my service was great everyone was very polite and professional but look at the picture ... And u can tell they did not wash the dish :(  


Update to Edgar/ the business:
I apologize for the delayed response I am just seeing this. It was 5 months ago, thank you for your response. Really appreciate it

Service was excellent! Even though they had a big private party. Always came back and check on us. Food was good tacos, bacon wrapped dates, stuffed peppers we try just about everything on the tapas menu.

Live music on a Friday. 
All you can eat Tapas. 

Service was great as was the food. 

Will definitely be back.

Great selection of tapas and good sangria. We did not have a bad dish there but favorites were stuffed dates, chicken empanadas, and chicken tacos. We liked live band and ambience. Good priced local tapas place.

I took my best friend here for some much needed sustenance . It was Friday night and it was packed...the wait was about 30 min. Edgar, the owner, totally hooked us up with a booth after only waiting for 10 min (he's such a good guy). 

My friends and I decided on the usual favorites and some new things that I hadn't explored yet...but I am so glad I did. 

Pan fried dates- pretty much a staple of any Barcelona visit
Beef carpaccio- the fried scallions and balsamic reduction make this one a winner 
Pork empenadas- kinda heavy for me but I don't think I was really in the mood for fried food
BBQ ribs- I was impressed. The sauce was flavorful but not overpowering, the pineapple chunks went well with the sauce and the meat practically fell off the bone. Will definitely order that again.
Spicy shrimp- this was one of my favorite new finds on the menu. The sauce was sweet and hot (think Thai chili sauce), the shrimp was succulent and it went great with bread (huge plus in my book). 

My friends and I enjoyed our meal immensely and will be back soon. Thank you Edgar :)

Excellent food. I have been here quite a few times because it's close to my house. Very good prices at happy hour. I am usually watching my diet, so I might only drop by and have a drink or two most of the times that I come here. Dogfish Head Indian Brown on draft is my drink of choice.  But for dinner on a date night, it's a great place.

Tapas Bar in the suburbs (ie. strip mall) with quite an extensive menu. Great options for vegetarians, omnivores and carnivores alike. Not too vegan friendly due to the excessive cheese factor in the menu. The decor reminded me of country bars/sandwich places in Texas so I didn't really get the Spanish vibe. I thought the prices were a little high ($5.50 to $6) for most tapas vegetarian items...rather small portions. 

The items I sampled:

1. Fried Goat Cheese ($6.50) - 4 panko crusted goat cheese balls deep fried and drizzled with honey balsamic. These balls tasted excellent. But I thought $6.50 for a small bite was a little outrageous

2. Potatoes Bravas ($6) - Tasted pretty bad. I don't know how to describe it except that it was a serious letdown. $6 for a small portion of baked potatoes? I don't think so....

3. Raviolis ($5.50) - Cheese medallion raviolis in a creamy tomato sauce. The sauce was excellent. But the raviolis (4 in an order) were undercooked

4. Vegetable Empanada ($5) - 2 empanadas with a bean, corn, mushroom filling served with more beans and corn and a tomato based sauce. The pastry was flaky, the filling tasty and the entire combination a rousing success!

5. Stuffed Piquillo Peppers ($7.50) - 3 peppers with goat cheese and beans and corns served in a tomato sauce. Tasty but definitely overpriced.

We had  pitchers of Mojitos that I felt were way too sweet. 

We were there as a group of 12 for a birthday. Edgar, the owner was very accommodating and helped us with the table arrangements as well as the cake cutting. The rest of the wait staff...oh gosh. It was a travesty. Water glasses were never filled, our orders were totally ignored for the longest time, drink orders were messed up, we got pork Empanadas to the table twice even though we explicitly told the waitstaff we were vegetarian multiple times and had ordered vegetable Empanadas. Just dismal service. They did make accomodations on the check and acknowledged the awful service but I'd rather have had water to drink with my meal than pay a few dollars less. 

These guys need to reduce prices and buck up on service before I'm tempted to try them again. 2.5 stars rounded up to 3.
Stopped here on the way out of town, I was just hungry and looked for something to eat. I am so glad I did, it's a great place.

Tried this place for lunch today with my fiancé. It was relatively busy for a Saturday afternoon which told me right away that it was going to be good. We were sat immediately and our waitress was very sweet, she explained the menu items and helped us make choices. We did the all you can eat lunch for $16 each. We ordered house salad, sautéed mushrooms, stuffed artichoke, chicken skewers and the beef carpaccio. The tapas come out bite size. Small portions but it do les allow you to try a high amount of dishes without getting too full. The presentation of each menu items was beautiful and everything was cooked to perfection. Our waitresses was wonderful. We will be coming back for dinner at a later date when we can try it with sangria! Great job Barcelona tapas, very wonderful.

Update: halfway through our meal the owner walked over to check on how we were enjoying our meal, we mentioned we loved it! And we would definitely be coming back for dinner and sangria.. He graciously brought us over a sample of his sangria which he makes himself in a barrel. IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE.

Been waiting to go to Barcelona's since it opened a couple months ago.  We have been to numerous tapas restaurants and our expectations were high.  This did not disappoint! 

Sangria's were fantastic!
Food was melt in your mouth good!
Service was over the top!
And atmosphere was quiet, and warm.

Our waiter really took care of us and brought us things we would have never tried on our own.  Overall an A+ experience!  So lucky to have such a quality high end tapas place near by.
This place used to be happening.  The food is good but the service really sucks.  The waitress was rude and negative on the place.

I celebrated my birthday here and was greeted by Angel.. He also took care of us. He bought a birthday desert and the food was amazing! The music, The Vibe And the food! A perfect combination .. A great place!!

With the recent closing of RE Tapas, this restaurant is the closest tapas bar in the area.  So the husband and I thought we'd give it a whirl.

No sangria with my tapas?  They did tell us beforehand that they weren't getting their liquor license until next week so we can forgive them.

We ordered: 
- Barcelona's Fries.  It was delicious with a good sauce.  Worth your money for $4.50.
- Stuffed Mushrooms.  Pretty good and wanted more.  Shitake mushrooms stuffed with chicken & chorizo and parmesan cheese.
- Surf and Turf.  Thought it wasn't worth the money for $10.
- Empanadas.  Choice of chicken or pork.  We got the pork and it was delicious with a chipotle aioli sauce.  My only beef was don't put empanada(s) as plural and just cut one in half.
- Sliders.  These were overcooked and charred.  I would've complained but I'm not one to ever send a dish back.

All in all, an okay dining experience.  I left feeling underwhelmed and wishing I had to gone to Firefly instead.  Maybe next time they'll win me over with some excellent sangria.

This place is okay. If you've never had tapas before this is the place is great because they have a good variety and the price is super reasonable. Don't expect to be blown away but the service is great. I would be willing to give it another shot though.

After looking at homes yesterday within the vicinity, we were starving. We initially wanted to go to "off the strip" but it was a 20 mins wait. The chef/owner was super nice there but we just couldn't wait...STARVING.  So we walked to Barcelona. First thing first, the brioches w 2types  of spread, spicy refried beans and the most insane butter spread. So flavorful!  Maybe because we were so hungry?  Nope, I tried it again after I was semi-full, and still at awe by it. Yum yum yum. Here are the things we ordered: 
-red sangria (yum and fruity, I was so peenk!!! Asian genes *_*)
-clams (fresh and have lots of flavor, w chunks oh goat cheese)
-Barcelona fries (ok, I like the firefly version better)
-sliders (very tasty, and it came w fries, if only I knew, I wouldn't have ordered the full order of fries. Was too much)

food: 4*
service: 5*

yay to Barcelona!

Be careful! The manager will send a verbal warning via your server if you order all you can eat and dare to share your fries! The all you can eat menu comes in tiny portions and a personal watch dog to ensure no one picks off of your plate. It was a tasteless experience; the servers are friendly.

Was told by friends to try Barcelona Tapas & Bar and I owe them one.  Matt was are server and I just said to him bring us what you do well and the treats just kept coming.  Stuffed dates are amazing.  Go and enjoy.
Food is great only downfall is the wait and lack of service but def recommend and will return

Came here to grab a quick lunch. I live in the neighborhood so the location is very convenient for me and I wanted to like this place.
When I came in at 12:30, the prime lunch time, this place was empty. Just us. I wondered why because this place has a very good reviews on Yelp.
When I was trying to order my food, it was very difficult to communicate with this waiter (only one waiter working). I didn't understand what he was saying with his accent and he didn't understand what I was saying with my accent (my accent is not that strong and this never happened before). It was a mess. I had to point with my finger on the menu then he finally understood. 
It took 30 min. for my food to come out (Carne Asada). Since I wanted a quick lunch, I was disappointed but I didn't complain. Maybe it takes 30 min. for them to cook thin meat medium. 
The fries that came with it were crispy and delicious but the meat was very tough. 
Their hummus was good and the location is great so I'll be back and order something else when I have enough time to have slow lunch.

Here for the Banana Foster Crepes!!!
But, since we were hungry we give few of their menu items a try, some of them even two tries :)

I don't really remember the other dishes we tried, but the Baqueron's was to die for.
Even with my husband not being a big artichoke fan, we order it twice! It's just the perfect little serving, a great tapas for just $6.50, with sweet white anchovies, red peppers,artichoke and black olives!

I think I could live on this dish and the Bananas foster crepes for the rest of my life! 

I'm giving it 3* because of their service...it wasn't very busy, so the server took his time to entertain his friends on a table rig next to ours...thank God somebody who looked like a manager stop by to ask us if we would like anything else...

We'll probably return, if we could get a better server thou...

1 dollar draft rolling rock and sangria at bar.band on Saturdays.call ahead for reservations.They have a 15 for 30 or 10 for 20 gift certificate on their website.It neglects to state you cant use it on promos like AYCE.After informing mgmt they accepted their own gift certificate. Okay all you can eat. 20 bucks for sangria pitchers.Just walk to the bar and buy them for a dollar. Staff was nice.but our waitress didnt seem to know much!!

Another wonderful birthday dinner at Barcelona! The service was wonderful. Alex took very good care of as well as all the servers who kept the delicious dishes coming. The bacon wrapped dates are always a must. There were two new choices I tried and loved! Get the Sliders and the sautéed mushrooms. You won't be disappointed. The hummus is one of my favorites. It has a great heat and texture. When Alex found out we were celebrating my birthday he brought our table Bananas Foster and flan! Both are delicious. We will be back again and again. Thank you so much for such a great evening!

UGH. 

THE MAIN REASON I'M GIVING THIS PLACE 2 STARS IS BECAUSE OF THE SERVICE.
I fully understand that a place is understaffed and has 1 waiter for the whole place but, our waiter -- UGHH!!!!!!

First, we order a pitcher of mojitos and he brings me a glass.

Worst was that my friend FOUND HAIR IN HIS RICE and told the waiter about it and he just laughed it off. 
Are you effing kidding me???!!
You know very well, if it was in my friend's rice then, there HAD to be hair in someone else's rice dish.

Sadly, the food we had was really yummy. Escargot, brie dates bacon, lamb, mojito. I would've gave this place 4 stars.
 
I'm just thankful his rice dish was the last thing we ate or else I would've been inspecting my food like crazy throughout dinner.

Went on the website and it said it opens at 11am. Checked yelp it says 1130, had a groupon for this place waited more than 30 min no one checked on us. Guy comes out doesn't even acknowledge us and leaves continues talking with his friend. Terrible service!!

My husband and I decided to go try this place out yesterday. It's right by us and we have been on a mission to try out all of the local restaurants. We both really enjoyed this little gem. The decor was welcoming and festive. The food was great. They have a daily happy hour and also an all you can eat menu. A great selection to chose from. Our servers were great and extremely attentive. 
We were told that they are also doing brunch on the weekends. This I am excited to try. I will update my review once we have.

I have only ever done the all you can eat tapas since I like to try little bits of everything at a place like this. The food isn't great but it isn't terrible. It's just OK. The sangria is decent as well and they usually have live music. Not the first place I would go but def not the last. The food gets two stars, the great service gets three stars.
Love this place! Best food, best customer service! Highly recommend... oh and the dates are the BOMB

If you are like my wife and I and love to go on a taste filled adventure, try Barcelona Tapas. The mood and decor of the dining room transports you to a far off place. The servers are experts at taste, and make great recommendations for food and drink. You can't go wrong with the all you can eat tapas, though the selection is greater on the general menu. 

We absolutely love the bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese. They are to die for. Sangria and mojitos are winners, as well as the wine selection and the general bar. 

We love sampling the huge variety of tapas on the menu. You should definitely go here and try for yourself. I take my wife here every year on her birthday. It's a special place for us.
The most excellent place for tapas dishes! Everything we ordered was delicious. The service was excellent and the ambiance inside the restaurant totally fits the mood of the dishes.
Great selection of tapas, great ambience and impeccable service. We can for lunch with kids and will be happy to come for the happy hour or diner for two. Really good job!

Delicious! The food was excellent and quick. Perfect portions. The staff was fantastic! Super attentive and nice. We loved the music and large seating. Came here originally to use a groupon, ended up getting happy hour and saving the groupon for later because we will be back!! 
We tried the calamari, tomato bruschetta, Mac & Cheese,  ravioli and stuff mushrooms OMG!! All yummy

Three stars/Four Stars.  I think it might vary, but I like to give the upper edge on this one.  Off in Southern Highlands, it's nice to have a tapas bar somewhere near Henderson which got me excited.  The service is pretty responsive, and the decor isn't shabby.  

The few things I tried here were the butternut squash soup which is delicious by the way, baked cheese, barcelona fries, lamb chops, and sliders.  I'm not sure why, but it didn't give me the satisfaction of being full.  The price is decent, but I think for the price, I would go to Firefly's.  I do like the friendly staff, and it's nice to have a place around this area to try out.

Fast service, food the best. Victor let us tasted tapas, barbeque, tacos, mushroom, bacon wrapped dates and almonds, calamare, paella, meatballs, ravioli, etc. Too much all you can eat food. Da best. Ask for habanero and jalapeno. Strongly recommend this place.

I came here a while ago, and I remember it being better before. I am used to going to Firefly but after that salmonella poisoning, I am never going back. The food here is mediocre. I would prefer to spend more money and go to Jaleo inside Cosmopolitan. However if you're on a budget this is a great place.

On Mondays, it is all you can eat tapas. And then Tuesday through Thursday starting at 6 PM it is all you can eat. 

My favorite thing on the menu are the fried goat cheese balls. They also bring out complimentary bread with hummus and brown honey butter and the honey butter is amazing!! 

The grilled octopus was not what I was expecting. Too chewy. Pork empanadas were all right. Patatas bravas were alright and the grilled red peppers tasted too vinegar-y. 

I went to Spain this past summer, so I guess no restaurant could ever compare to what I tasted out there.
Such a friendly environment where they make you feel at home. Bartender barely new me but she treated me like a regular thats hard to find in Vegas

I ordered delivery and chose some healthy tapas for dinner for my sister and I. They were delicious and delivered before 30 minutes! Only reason it's a 4 and not a 5 star review is because the food spilled all over the place when being delivered. Kinda messy, but still delectable! Will definitely order again!
Yum! Dinner salad, stuffed dates, baked cheese, spicy shrimp, sliders, Mac & cheese, chicken skewers, steak skewers, mashed potatoes, roasted peppers. Super good and great service!

I was reluctant to try this place again because I didn't love it the first time.
