Supposedly this place was opened by someone who helped create the menu at Firefly, but I can attest (in my opinion) the menu here doesn't even come close to Firefly. Reason I gave this a second try was we were looking to have a cocktail in my neighborhood and not at a smoky bar, when we got there, no one was in the place. I ordered a glass of wine and the person I was person with ordered a single malt, which they don't carry, ok no big deal, in the meantime I showed our waitress my Yelp check in which displays 50% drinks, no where in the check in does it say "sangria only" which is all they will honor. We ordered 2 apps, one came out, the other never made it to the table. Again, we were the only customers in the place. When the check arrived, we noticed we had been charged for both, brought it to her attention and she replies "well I will have to have my mgr take it" and acted like it was a bother???!!! I don't foresee myself ever going back to this place and I have a couple Restaurant.com vouchers that will go unused if anyone wants them.

I live in the mountains edge area and was on the way home with my boyfriend in search of a place to eat nearby. We decided to try Barcelona tapas. What a great find!  Our waiter was knowledgable and friendly. The service was very fast and the food was excellent. We both did the AYCE with a pitcher of sangria. The stuffed dates were one of the best I have ever had. This place is comparable to Firefly but better in my opinion because with the AYCE you can try different selections that are single portions. The atmosphere was quaint and There was also live musical accompaniment!  Overall a great dining experience.

I want to start this review off by thanking our server Luis. he was so accommodating, and definitely made our experience worthwhile.

just recently moved back over to southern Highlands and wanted to try out all the new restaurants in the area. my sister and I decided to check out Barcelona since we wanted some flavor. 

the vibe was welcoming from the start. I absolutely loved the live band playing and it made a fun atmosphere to be in. Luis greeted us and we were so hungry, we were just firing off our order. they had an all you can eat offer for a select menu of tapas for $22 but we just decided to order whatever. we went with the spinach salad, bruschetta, ceviche, stuffed dates and ravioli. everything was absolutely great. 

we ordered the meatballs which we were unhappy with for a certain, but Luis made sure it was handled. he reassured us that they wanted to keep their guests happy, and to have that kind of experience with great dishes and excellent service is what makes this place very deserving of 5 stars. looking forward to returning.

I'm preggo so I was craving empandas but wanted more just not sure what else. Tapas sounded amazing and I came here. I got the empandas that were perfect. The SO  got the lamb that was set in a wine reduction. It was awesome too.  The service was quick, and pleasant. 
10/10 can't wait to go back.

Went too far to having something different to eat hear we came to the right spot and the best food tried after long time. Believe me, the short rib i started with was so amazing, and the pork plate i had was the bomb!!!!, we had Shrimps with hot souse and they were also very tasty!, my wife had a cocktail with the happy mood bartender Moolisa, she know how to treat the customer right! we were very happy and stuffed for the night...
Let me first say that I really love this place.  The food and drinks are perfect for after work.  Where Barcelona has a near fatal flaw is in their bar stools...all of which slope down by about 5%.

Whoa! WTH happened in the past couple months? We went last night with a coupon and were pretty much insulted by the waiter! We gave him our coupon before eating, which he took, no problems. 
When it was time to order desert, the waiter condescendingly asked us if we had a coupon for that too?!!!! Our desert came 20 minutes later (bananas foster) and it came out black as tar!!! We went to send it back, when the server said, "yeah, it's a little burnt, huh?". C'mon, really?!! If you knew it was burnt, why'd you serve it?!!!

I am super happy that there is a Tapas restaurant near my neighborhood that I can go to anytime to enjoy some small plates and a pitcher of sangria with either my boyfriend or a small group of friends.  The restaurant is also a bar so I can even get my alcohol fix at the same time if I feel the sangria isn't cutting it.

Here are my favorite plates there:
The FREE bread they serve at the beginning: it's warm and toasted when it comes out, and the orange butter (not sure of the flavor) is super yummy.  I think I can come here and eat just the bread and I'll be content
Pan Fried Dates: this is a salty/sweet delight and is definitely a must try for any Tapas first timers
Mac n Cheese: it has fun shells! And just the right amount of cheese.  This is a good carb to eat with all the small plates!
Mar y Monte (Surf n Turf): my favorite part about this dish is actually the sausage and the mash potatoes.  Also, the meat is cooked medium so its tasteful
Diabla Shrimp: good and spicy too!
Ham and Cheese Croquets: yum!
Sliders: These are super good and not really a small plate!

The so-so:
Empanadas: I've only tried once; thought it was OK
Egg-plant Cannelloni: The egg plant is yum, but the rest of it is too salty
Sangria: it does the job, but the fruit could be marinated in there; so they make it a little different here.  But I'll still order it for sure!

I have  yet to try the dessert and the rest of the huge menu!  I'll be back for sure!

The only reason I would give this restaurant two stars is for the Sangria. 

I was so disappointed by Barcelona Tapas...The food is really over salted, too garlicky, and just doesn't taste good. It's over-priced for sub-par food and sub-par service. I'm a self-proclaimed "foodie," hailing from a city that prides itself on good flavor and good energy and this is not a restaurant I would return to or suggest my friends visit. 

:(
Amazing food! The sangria is authentic and our server Tee was so attentive. Happy hour from 4-7pm! All around, a great treat.

The food was tasty I have no complaints about the food but the fact that I have to argue with my server that it's 1899 for the all you can eat special when he tells me it's $26 and we have a party of 4.   We told him we saw it online and he would not honor it we even showed him.  We were literally about to get up and walk out as we were so frustrated on the principle of the fact not really the $7 just the principle.

Then we noticed in the window a huge sign that says all day Monday all you can eat 1899 so we decide to stay order and don't mention anything until we're done he brings us the bill it's $26 per person I walk him outside show him the large sign in the window and tell him buddy change the price because we're not paying $26.   And he did 

Again Ill stress the food was good but because of the headache I probably won't be going back.   If they're not going to honor 1899 on Mondays they should take the sign down I could take it down in 30 seconds

I wish I had our servers name he was a Mexican guy didn't speak the best English and was working at 3 o'clock on Monday, August 28

We loved the place. Didn't get to stay too long, but we will defiantly be back. 

There were good tastes along with some great wine choices. I believe every day they have different offers and specials. 

If you like a laid back, comfortable place to nosh on some tapas, you won't be disappointed. 

Not sure what it would take to make it a 5 star review. But maybe next time I will have a better outlook.
really nice restaurant, great people and great mussles... the staffs are really well mannered
Amazing food and Sangria! I been here several times and also our book club has choose this place to meet as well. Customer Service is great and the food is just amazing.

Came here on a Groupon, but would come back without one as the prices were reasonable.

The decor was very nicely done, lighting was dimmer, for those who need light to read menu!  LOL - yes that would be me!  Hahaha

The sangria was sweet, and definitely strong!  Had to pass it over to hubby to finish. 

Service was a little slow, not sure if they were ready for the crowd that was there that night.  I did appreciate the owner pitching in and helping his staff, even if it meant two people coming over and asking for our drink orders.  He did come over to explain they didn't expect the crowd and he had to call other servers to come in...  He was very friendly and polite, and I appreciate that he wanted our honest feed back on food.

Ok, now on to the food.  Tapa style and we love sharing so it was perfect!  Everything we ordered was great!   great place to share some small bites, drink some sangria and really just chill...

We made the reservations for my mom's birthday a month ago from Chicago. The menu we chose was excellent.  The food was excellent.  The location south of the strip, but honestly,  I can say it was worth the drive. I look forward to dining there when I'm back in town.

I've lived in Vegas for a year now, and just down the street is quite a few restaurants that I've been wanting to try.  Barcelona Tapas & Bar is one of them.
Finally last night my husband and I decided to go and try it before our move to London next month.
I was not impressed!
The only thing good about this place was our server. A very tall and handsome guy with a lot of enthusiasm!  I believe he may of been the owner.
When we walked in the ambiance of the place was just 'Meh' and it took a few moments before anyone even acknowledged that we were even there. 
Our table was at one of the bar 'booths' which was uncomfortable and the table was so short that we couldn't even cross our legs.  We had to sit next to each other, not across from each other, because one side of the booth was a booth like seat and the other side of the table were these short little bar type stools with no backs.  Very uncomfortable!
The food was OK, not wonderful, but just OK. Although I must say that the
 Pan Fried Dates................................$ 5.50 
(Pitted dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon with merlot reduction and sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles.) were VERY yummy!!  But everything else, I'm sorry to say, was just not very good.
I've had better!
The House Made Sangria was delicious though! I would recommend a pitcher of that any time. Half off pitchers and certain foods are at Happy Hour (Monday-Friday's from 4pm-7pm).
So I'm sorry to say that I'm only giving this place a 2 star rating because I agree that it is just that;  Meh.  I've experienced better!

We've been going to Barcelona more and more often. We love tapas style so we can sample wide variety of food. We have our favorites and we try new item or two. Favorites are beef carpaccio, steamed clams, fried goat cheese, Barcelona fries. Will definitely keep going back!

We had the all you can eat for $26 and had lots of very delicious Tapas!! Our favorite were the bacon wrapped dates, pork empanadas and chicken green chille skewers.  The red sangria was very good!! The service was wonderful too!!

Review not on food...since I never had the chance..This is for the OWNER a heads up I am sure he would have wanted my money and business..sorry your employees did not..
Honestly..I don't pull my yelp up every 5 minutes .  I actually stopped here on my way home from a doctor's appt. Because I was hungry and have a lot to do when I get home. I will start at the beginning..how this went down..I am writing,this because I am shocked at just how..well unbusiness like my lunch stop went..I pull up..get out look at menu by door..cool I thought have done a Tapas Bar 1 time..figured let me try it.
Walk in..waiter comes over to seat me.  (This is 1 something in the afternoon midweek..see my pic no one was there.) He leads me to a table..I ask for a booth..me bad I guess..I saw 3 open booths and no one waiting..and he is not pleased about it..I could tell..  My first mistake .....he seats me ..I order 1 Margarita on the rocks...the place is lovely..decor is great..nice and clean too with a full bar.
I feel kinda happy to try something new.  He leaves the regular menu only.
Big yellow banner in front is promoting Tapas Lunch Menu 15.99
..I have never been here before..I tell him that..I say.."How does the Tapas lunch work?"  
He did not look happy ..goes gets Tapas special menu..walks away..
Ok
I look it over...compare 
.the dishes to main menu description..I am not an idiot..have traveled all over the world..I guess I missed Spain ok!...I get it..but still would like just some common courtesy to a first time customer who lives in Mountains Edge..down the street but new to Las Vegas..and possible repeat customers too.
He comes back I ask so..how does the Tapas Lunch work? 
I was in a good mood everything good..Waiter answer..
"Oh no..the kitchen is so busy right now"
....What?
Ok..but how do I order? Get a few items? Then try more?
What I surmised from his answer was. .you get one of each but not all together..or something like that..
Confusing... .again I hear.."we are really busy".
1 more time I say.."ok"..dumbfounded I am hearing this..
So I say again I am not sure how to order and AGAIN
with a look of panic or angry or just.well I don't  know.. he says."We are so busy".."the kitchen"...and leaves ...just weird. 
He returned and I ask him is it better for me to just order an item from the menu? vs the Tapas Lunch? he looked befuddled..and by this time I can tell with the pissed look ...he really just does not care...almost became a silent stand off..
So I say...well you know what you appear to be too busy for me to be here..I guess I will just leave and go somewhere else..he shrugs and says.."oh ya..ya..maybe better" with his accent.
.LOL....how much for my drink..? 5 bucks he says..I say ok then he brings a bill for 9.99..Whatever..I leave 10 dollars and walk to the exit door.
As I leave I glance over the empty restaurant into the bar...wow
2 customers on the end of the bar sitting by the front window.
..that was it for the bar...listening to the female bartender and the waiter that was too busy? He was,there too.. with his back to me doing nothing..talking...
So I say..to them (yes I was that person) as I look over at them..
Excuse me? You are too busy?  Obviously you are too busy for my money too.  Have a great day..
Wow..just wow
I am posting this so the owner is aware ..just dumbfounded at zero customer service and rudeness.  So sad..It was truly a cute place but the employees made it ugly
Ended up walking down further down the strip mall and going to a coffee shop with great service!
I truly am sad..it ticked a lot of things I like... had a bar..Cool Vibe..Close to Home..sports on the TVs..
..I love to support neighborhood businesses..
Very dissapointing..and sad because I really hoped to like it.

:(
View my picture before I got up to leave..of the "busy" place..

Was very disappointed. We have frequented this restaurant before and decided to go for date night. Food came out way to fast and tasted like it was from old supply. Chicken was rubbery,meatballs not done,bacon dates tasted mushy. So sad we will not be coming back.

The one complaint that I had about this restaurant was that the food tasted too-homemade. The general atmosphere was very Spanish, I loved the server and I even loved the fact that they offered a free sangria upon check-in. However, their food was a little bland in general, and the portion for their appetizers were a joke. I understand they are tapas, but I could barely taste the main ingredients since they were sliced too thinly or cut into tiny little pieces. 

The paella was served in a huge portion, but again, it just tasted like homemade. 

However, the pros about this restaurant is that it priced at a more reasonable margin that any other spanish tapa places in Vegas. Also their service is really good as well as their sangrias. This, though, is a really far drive from my house, so I am not sure when I will go back the next time, but definitely willing to come back
Great place for happy hour drinks and apps. Plenty of tapas options, all of which were prepared well. Prices outside of happy hour may be a bit steep however.

Yuuuum empanadas were so delicious. Pork and beef served with either aioli or tomatillos type soft. Drinks were super strong :) :)... chicken and rice soup a little under salted but flavorful nonetheless. The bread and hey serve with hummus and honey butter delish!  Oh and I can't forget the service. The server was so nice even fixed our order when we ordered the wrong item.

Victor Altamirano was one of the better servers I've ever come across. Great guy.  The food and prices are bit outta sync but I still had a fun time dining in.  He should be recognized, because the majority of my experience is a positive one because of him.  I feel the need to mention ice been to better tapas places.  If you're around the neighborhood.  They got coffee and small items to snack on that should put you in a good mood.
Our server was so great. Food was really good. Nice to get off the strip once in a while. Terrific sangria...woukd totally recommend.

Theres live music and people are so friendly! They'll make you feel like home :-) i actually feel like I am in Barcelona lol

The steak and fries were a little too salty though, ive never tried their eat-all-you-can. Maybe next time i try it i can give a higher rating

Edgar makes sure that his customers are happy, and an involved owner who truly cares definitely helps. The pan fried dates are wonderful. I have yet to have something off of the menu I did not like. I went with a friend who is from Madrid and she was not disappointed in the least and she was on a mission to find authentic tapas. I've been here over 40 times since they opened, and have always been pleased. 
The one downside that is not their fault is that Yelp thinks they are by Molly Malones and so the Check In offer doesn't work. If you just mention the offer, Edgar will make sure that it is honored.

Food was mediocre and the service was horrible.  Slow, rude waitress.  Looks like it attracts the boozer crowd.

They offer tons of coupons then get pissed off when you try to use one.  I live 2 blocks from there and will never go back.

My gosh this place is out of the way for my husband and I who live in the Northeast part of town! Our banker recommended this place. We absolutely loved it! We were shocked at how quickly the place filled up; there were a couple of people at the bar and another couple in the dining room when we walked in and before we knew it the whole restaurant was full! Poor servers...... but regardless of that our dining experience was incredible. The staff did their best to provide great service and that's all that matters to us. We will definitely drive 40 minutes to dine here again.

Wow. So as much as people might hate me for saying it. I liked this place better than firefly! I mean strictly the food was so amazing that it's worth the drive from whatever part of town you are in. I came with friends on a Sunday night and it was pretty dead. Decently nice enough interior. Clean and decorated. So we each ordered two dishes and every single item was amazing. The butternut squash soup, veggie empanadas, manchego Mac and cheese, fried goat cheese, fried artichokes, tortilla Española were all amazing. Great portion size. Just enough to share with a few people of each dish so u get to try lots of food. Then we got dessert of bananas foster crepes, bread pudding and flan. The flan was nothing to write home about but still solid. As we're te other desserts. Overall an amazing meal.

Went here for date night with my hubby-so glad we did. The restaurant is small and intimate, and totally cute. We went on a Friday night so they had a live band which made the ambiance that much better. We had the tacos al pastor which weren't as spicy as I anticipated and oh so yummy. Probably the best I've ever had. We also had the fried goat cheese balls, beef empanadas, croquetas, Mac and cheese and lamb chops...all which were so good! Red sangria was excellent as well. Great date night!

The food is just okay to be honest I have been here a few times I think their portions should be a little bit bigger. But then again it is tapas... But one big concern of mine is there is one toilet for male and one for female. I had to wait 15-20 min to use it. I do not know how good their slots are. But it's a okay place

I been here a couple of times because my friend lives fairly close to this establishment. I'm not a huge tapas fan but I do enjoy it when I go out to a tapas restaurant. As for Barcelona Tapas and Bar, I actually enjoy this place. The pan fried dates are definitely a staple here. That is one thing everyone must order when coming here. and when they bring out the bread, it comes with a butter that the house makes that is the best tasting butter I have ever had in my life. It just tastes so damn good. I like the beef carpaccio as well.
  Ordered the empanadas and wasnt that big of a fan on that one. The sauteed tilapia was pretty good.
Very good place for a quick bite, love the sangria. Great service, they are always friendly and polite.

The AYCE tapas is a good deal ($26) if you have a group or are with very hungry people! Unfortunately it was just a table of 2 and the items I really wanted were not available on the AYCE menu. 

The items I did have were:

Octopus
Steamed Mussels
Stuffed mushrooms
Ribeye bites
Beef empanada ($1 on Wednesdays!)

Also, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free sangria! Only thing that sucked was that you only get 1 per table and it's a glass... so my friend and I had to share. That was weird. Other than that though, it was great service and delicious tapas!! I want to come back and try the other items! Also, Monday they have a cheaper AYCE lunch menu for $18.99. Highly recommend this place!

This is my second visit here. I'm addicted... heart and soul. I love their AYCE menu. I tried new things today not enjoyed before. I brought my husband this time and had to win 2/3 rock, paper, scissors to beat him out of AYCE sushi.  He loves the calamari here as well as the dates. They're stellar morsels of goodness. I'm on my second glass of red sangria, too. It's so good here.

I have to say my wife and I have lived in southern Highlands for about two years and only came in one time and it was for breakfast.  Food wasn't bad, just not our taste as far as breakfast.  TODAY we stopped in for a quick bite and a beer, discovering two things.  Number one is $1 tacos on Thursday's.  Tried one of each (beef, chicken, pork).  The el pastor and chicken tacos were amazing!  2nd was Victor.  I'll be honest at first I thought he was a little rude until I realized how busy he was!  Once things calmed down he came to our table and explained the menu, specials and made our experience completely worth while!  We will probably be coming back every week now very pleased!  Thank you!!

I have been to this place three times now.  The first time- it just opened and they did not have their alcohol in stock yet.  But the waiters were very enthusiastic and of course wanted our business so they even offered that we can bring in a bottle of wine and drink it with our foods.  
We were already kinda tipsy so we just opt for the food.  It tasted good then but almost anything is good after "drinking".

The second time I was here I was with someone who did not eat certain foods and I was kinda full to begin with.  So we shared the EMPANADA.  From what I could remembert...it was not memorable.

This time...I wanted to give it one more shot.  I brought my son with me this time hoping he would like it and he would be able to give me honest  "TASTE BUDS OPINIONS"

We got there before dinner rush and there was only one couple in the whole place.  The host/waiter dude was in the back.  Maybe he did not hear us but maybe there should be a bell or something to let him know there are customers.  I had to go towards the back to find him and ask if we should sit ourselves.  

We chose a booth which the bench was lower than the table.  (just an observation)  My son had to get our menus since no one was really helping us. 

So on the quickness for your reading...

Waiter- not very talkative, ok for attentiveness, easy on the eyes but not warm.
Atmosphere- the walls were black and ok "so-called Spanish" decorations.  Lots of TV's and there was a full bar. 
*House Salad- too vinegary, the sliced apples tasted as if they used an apple that was old
*Calamari-bland, needed salt and seemed rushed out of the fryer since the batter was not fully crisp.  But at least the tentacles were there.  
*Son's Sliders- he was sad there was no cheese (LOL).  My son was not too happy and said he'd rather have McDo's.  So I had to take a bite since most kids would rather have McDo's.  The burger was dry and tasted like ground beef with the Lipton Onion Soup Mix.  He actually said he'd rather have home-made burgers.  hahahhaha
and the french fries that came with it...he said it's like those fries you get in a can....bwahahahaha.
*Some sliced Steak thingy with mashed potatoes.  It was not hard and chewy but it was very salty.  
My son even tried to dip his dry-ass burger in the sauce of the steak...but  it did not help. 
***White Sangria-tasted just like cheap white wine with diced apple in it.  (To make good Sangria...it must be made overnight and have the flavors marry each other)-NO I will not share my special recipe which I promise will beat the SANGRIA @ CHA CHA CHA'S in the Haight in San Francisco.  I assure you that. 

Anyways....I think this place is only staying in business because of the full bar and all the promos they run.  

I THINK....they should close the place and I can take over running it as a Filipinasian Karaoke Bar and Restaurant....
Whadda you think?????
SOUTHERN HIGHLANDS  need some new flavor and some excitement.

-Firefly is and will be better....sorry Barcelona.

Love this place. It's located in a strip mall in Southern Highlands. Go during their double happy hours...4-6 then 10- midnight.
Again meeting large party...family in from California...this is a convenient location for hungry people driving in from LA.
We were greeted with friendly staff that was all too happy to hook us up with sangrias. They have a similar menu to Fireflies. 
The pan fried dates are just a staple.
We tried the Baqueróns which is white anchovies & red pepper on toast..not a fan & too fishy. The empanadas are ok, the camarones al ajillo (garlic shrimp) were good & good to dip bread in. And some other things ordered on other side of table but after a few sangrias couldn't remember the names :) We did enjoy the shared flan for dessert as it got passed once & never returned.
A nice alternative if you don't want the busy atmosphere of the other tapas place.

Screaming kids throughout the restaurant from the time we got there until the time we left...horrible! Food was mediocre at best. Filet was very grisly! Empanadas where nasty tasting.
Service was awesome!!!

Know in advance that this is more a Mexican/Spanish fusion tapas restaurant.

Food: The all you can eat option is the best. Baja Fish Tacos and the Bacon-wrapped Dates were excellent. 

Service:  Staff was attentive and the Chef greeted us which was a nice touch.

Atmosphere:  Quiet, restaurant may be more lively for dinners though.

(Review was modified on April. 10, 2015. After 2 more visits with the All You Can Eat option, I am happy to say that I'm a fan.)

Due to all of the positive reviews, we wanted to come in and check this place out. We went in for lunch and had the most expensive bad dining experience ever. Went with the all you can eat and got a pitcher of sangria. Both were far below average. Due to the terrible service by Victor A., we all left there with a bad taste in our mouths (literally and figuratively). We were the only people in there during our two hour lunch, which should have been a red flag from the get go. I have no idea how this place has 4 stars with so many reviews. Will not be back.

I was curious about this place for a little bit and waited for my family to be here to go - since they're from Barcelona.  It was simply amazing! The place itself is super cool, it's casual but full of decoration details that will catch your eyes. 
They have live music on Fridays, it starts around 6:30pm, we obviously missed out on it but It was still a great experience. The gentleman and the lady who were taking care of us were absolutely wonderful! They were both very patient in explaining to me what each item was and they were great with my family members that don't speak English. 

We did the all you can eat for $25,99 per person and the menu selection was really good. The order size is small so if you're really hungry order a couple of things at once. Food came out pretty quick and we tried almost everything on the menu, the flavors were just divine - just watch for the sauces as they can seem too spicy for some.
Desert is included and I recommend the bread pudim, it was fresh and warm.
We had a great time enjoying great food, I'm going back for sure!

Food was really good or okay it was a hit or miss, I tried alot but I'd go again to see if I like more stuff. Waitress was a sweet nice chick. Seen someone walk in a few min before closing and I got more discouraged for her than she did. They do offer good specials tho...

Loved this place!! Me & my boyfriend decided to try this spot out after hearing they had Happy Hour. We called several times to get the hours but no one answered. So we decided to just stop in. We missed Happy Hour, but no big deal. They had an "all you can eat" tapas for $24. We both decided to go with that. I also got my free sangria from checking in on Yelp (it was yummy). 

The All You Can Eat menu was large and there was a ton of good options. The portions are smaller than the actual tapas, but not a problem because if you like it you can just order another. 

Some of the things we ordered:
-Mac N Cheese (we ended up eating 4 of these)
-Bacon Wrapped Dates (my absolute favorite. I had 3 orders)
-Beef AND Chicken Empanadas
-Beef Taco
-Albondigas (meatball)
-Garlic Fries
-Mashed Potatoes (only thing we disliked. Very dry)
-Sliders
-Cheese Ravioli 

You also get a dessert so we got the Tres Leches and Bread Pudding with caramel sauce. Both were delicious. 


We will definitely be coming back!

Barcelona Tapas has solved my dilemma with tapas. I love tapas but $4.00 here $ 6.00 there can add up quickly  but not here because they have all you can eat tapas for about $30.00 every day!! 
This is what is on their all you can eat menu: 
Pan Fried Dates
House Salad
Tacos (Pastor, Beef, Chicken)- I had the pastor tacos . They are the size of a street taco. The meat was tender and nicely seasoned. 
Spinach Salad
Empanadas (Chicken, Beef, Pork, Veggie)- The pork Empanadas have chunks of meat with a flaky crust. 
Salami Banderas
Grilled Steak or Chicken Skewers-The grilled steak skewer was one of my favorites. The meat was soft and juicy I ate them with some mashed potatoes . Delicious! 
Tortilla Espanola
Albondigas- This is not soup just so you know it is a single meatball . 
Mashed Potatoes- I ordered this as a side to some of my meat dishes. 
Chicken Picatta
Cheese Ravioli
Croquetas- The last time I had a croqueta or croquette I was in Amsterdam so it's nice to know I can get them here too!  
Sautéed Mushrooms- If you love sauteed mushrooms you need to order this! Very addicting. 
Couscous- I wasn't too crazy about the couscous . 
Stuffed Artichokes - The stuffed artichokes were also good the artichoke was soft enough where it was easy to chew. 
Tomato Bruchetta- The Bruchetta was just okay . I still prefer the Bruchetta at Grimaldis. 
Chicken & Rice soup
Fried Calamari- The Calamari was excellent! They know how to cook it where it isn't rubbery.
Sliders
Mac & Cheese- The Mac & Cheese is topped with bits of bacon. You know what they say bacon makes things better!! 
Barcelona Fries
Tilapia & Capers
Marinated Olives
Stuffed Piquillo Pepper
Stuffed Mushrooms - The stuffed mushrooms covered in a blanket of cheese is also a must!  
Beef Carpaccio
You also get to choose 1 dessert : 
Patatas Brava
Bread pudding with caramel Sauce
Flan
Tres Leches- The Tres Leches was good but it is a bit on the drier side which is not a bad thing for me. 
Sweet
Empanada
Vanilla Ice Cream
The service is also very quick and accommodating. You didn't have to wait too long to place your next order and I never went thirsty. This is a great place to meet up with friends and chat over tapas!

We Love this place ..Service is perfect ..the food is great and we love the variety. 
My favorite is the steak skewers and my Hubby loves the fish tacos. it's all yummy. The owner Edgar comes to the table and greets you which is nice. Small local place with great service and food. We live 25 miles away from this restaurant but it's worth the drive. We have shared it with out of town guests as well.
Al pastor dollar tacos on Thursdays  so yummy. Beef carpaccio and stuffed dates are yummy too. Definitely will be a regular here
The ceviche is my favorite and am only disappointed as its not part of the half price appetizer during happy hour.

Its been awhile since I ate here, then I realized I didn't even review this place yet.  For me, this is conveniently located in my neighborhood, Southern Highlands.  I've been coming here usually to partake in their super awesome happy hour during game time.  Oh you can't miss the big sign that shows off their $1 PBR specials either.  

We finally came in to dine for their brunch.  We heard from a friend that their breakfast is a must try...mmmm hmmmm it sure is.  Only on Saturday and Sunday from 10a-1pm.

We tried the Barcelona Benedict $6 and Chorizo Hash $6 roasted potatoes with chorizo and roasted tomato poached egg then we couldn't resist and added the escargot and banana pancakes...lol yes odd combinations.  

The Benedict is a homemade turkey patty, topped with your poached egg and roasted pepper topped with hollandaise sauce.  I think if there was spinach added to it, it would be even better...but that's just my taste buds.  Since the hubs had that I went for the chorizo hash.  Oooooooh weeee, that was a combination of deliciousness.  It's served in a hot plate of melted goodness.  Then on to escargot. Save your bread and dip that in the garlic butter mushroom sauce of the escargot.  They are not shy on giving you a lot of escargot.  When it comes out and served to your table, other patron will say, "what's that smell?"  

Lastly, the banana pancakes.  I'll tell you why this is a must try.  First dessert for breakfast is awesome.  Second, The syrup topping is their banana foster syrup....need I say more?  

Service was awesome, Kelli was an awesome host.  We enjoyed everything we even reserved for Super Bowl!

I have been here about 6 times and the food has gone downhill with each visit. What a shame, as this place use to be good. The only recommendations I have is the bacon wrapped dates, and the complimentary bread with the butter spreads.  Everything else...meh!! On my last visit, a few months back, I sat at the bar to enjoy a little video poker with a glass of red sangria and some bacon dates, after a long day at work. I did not feel relaxed, as the waiter would not leave me alone because I was not interested in ordering a full meal. After I was done, I cashed out but it was such an ordeal to get my money. They had to call 2 people over, just to give me $12 bucks!! One would think that I had hit a jackpot!! That made me feel uncomfortable.  I would have stayed longer, but the waiter was constantly glancing at my poker playing, and you could tell he wanted to voice his two cents with just about every move I would make with the cards I would keep!! Ugh!! Plus they have weird rules and policies written on a piece of paper tapped by the video machines. Not going back for gaming...that's for sure!! Or the food...

I came here due to visiting a friend on this side of town.  I visited here about a year ago, and not much has changed.  The one thing that did, and the reason this is 4 stars instead of 5 is on Mondays they used to have a special, the all you can eat Tapas was lunch priced all day, instead of dinner priced.  The added charge was not cool.  It was Monday, I was excited for the all you can eat, so I paid it.  

The tacos were great, the dates are a can't miss item, the fries are great, and the slider was amazing as well.  All in all if you're looking for great food, and a great atmosphere, this is an amazing option.  

I know other people have other favorites when it comes to Tapas places, but if you compare prices, this one serves up quality food at decent prices.  If you're looking to sample a lot, you can definitely get your money's worth here.  

I'll be back next time I'm on this side of town, or if I want to bring friends to a cool place.

Have been here 3 times and the food is great and the drinks are excellent and they have live music.the best deal is the all you can eat for $22.99 they keep the food coming and it's great but on one occasion the server wasn't bringing us all that we ordered

I went there for the first time tonight with my girlfriend.  The happy hour (1/2 off) is a pretty good deal, price-wise. The food is so-so. Nothing was bad but nothing jumped out as fantastic either.  We ordered drinks and the first round of tapas and then our waiter didn't come back for over 30 minutes. We were out of food, adult beverages and water for over 30 mins. I would have ordered more food but we were so irritated we just settled the check and left.  When i flagged him down to get the check there wasn't even an apology or anything. 

I would only go back if I'm starving and in the neighborhood, not worth driving back out there. 

In summary: food; so-so. Service: TERRIBLE

Meh. Underwhelmed. Was hoping for a decent Thursday night experience. Came for happy hour. Calamari was the best thing we had. Stuffed mushrooms- eh. Artichoke- soso. Carpaccio was missing depth of flavor. Everything was pretty bland and so was the service. Nothing spectacular. Wanted it to be great, and got just mediocre. Oh well.

Excellent all around! All the food we got tasted amazing and wasn't overpriced. The staff was friendly and when the check came it was even cheaper than we expected. The chicken empanadas and stuffed jalapeños were my favorites!!
One of my families favorites!!! Great service, live music on Friday nights.  Best happy hour and all you can eat in Southern Highlands.

First time here and already off to a bad start. 5 min without any greeting from anyone. No hostess up in front and I believe only one guy runnin the whole show. The food is what pretty much saved this review. The food was good but service and experience is also the big part of a restaurant

We were served a complimentary plate of grilled bread, hummus and a garlic cream cheese spread (2.5 Forks).  Our first order was the obligatory pan fried dates with almonds in a balsamic reduction sauce and sprinkled with goat cheese (4 Forks) and Manchego mac and cheese (3.5 Forks).  The second round was less successful: camarones al Ajillo (garlic shrimp) that were slightly overcooked and served at room temperature (2 Forks), a mundane house salad (2 Forks) and pastelillos pollo (chicken cake) served with a gribiche sauce (2.5 Forks).  We closed out the meal with a chocolate tres leches cake.

A rating of 2.5 would be appropriate.

The restaurant feels locally owned.I like that. It doesn't feel like a corporate machine. The servers were very attentive and on point. Every dish delivered I loved. The All You Can Eat menu is a perfect way to try out items, as each portion is petite. I didn't leave feeling gross or anything like that . . . I would definitely recommend checking the place out.
Been here quite a few times and it seems to just get better and better. We had great food, great service, good sangria, and live music. Couldn't ask for more. Perfect for a dinner/night out.

I took a group of 15 to the Southwest Barcelona Tapas location today. I had called to make a reservation but they do not make reservations. We asked for separate checks and the waiter was very gracious to do that for us. He was all alone but we told him we would wait. (That is why I called a couple of days prior to coming so the restaurant would be prepared). Anyway, he did a terrific job. The kitchen was slow but we were enjoying the food and company. The food came out in dibs and dabs so I assume the kitchen was also understaffed. 

The tapas were very good. Most came out hot. A few were lukewarm so I guess they sat for awhile before the waiter could bring them. Most of us has the all you can eat for $18.99. I tried the calamari (delicious), Spanish meatballs (delicious), stuffed mushrooms, stuffed artichoke. Several others tried empanadas, chicken skewers, steak skewers, salad, mac and cheese, tacos. All looked good and I certainly would go again.

Just ok. I was seduced by their "all you can eat $22.99" out front and saw their menu online and was very intrigued. Then I when inside to see that the all you can eat menu consisted of nothing that looked appetizing on the online menu, so I ordered a la cart. It's hard to hold this against a place but the food came out too fast, like there's no way it was prepared for me. It was definitely mass produced, and "braised beef" tacos were just ground beef tacos.  It wasn't busy but service was good, I would have definitely paid $30 for a FULL all you can eat menu. All in all my check $52 for 4 items and 2 beers, not worth it but not a rip off.

I'm stunned by the number of positive reviews of this restaurant. We went recently for happy hour and were extremely disappointed in the quality of the food. Many dishes shared the exact same sauce, and, as a person who spent six months living in Spain, I can say without question that this restaurant wouldn't last a week if it opened there. The food is not up to par, and the overall quality is very poor. Those who said Barcelona compares favorably to Firefly are delusional in my opinion. We won't be back.

We found a coupon for this restaurant in the 89113 booklet and decided to try it since we had a great experience at the FireFly and another tapas restaurant at the Aria.
Although the restaurant had a nice atmosphere with 3-4 flat screens, the music was too loud.
We ordered the tuna tartar which was mixed with too much mayo but the chips were wonderful; the shrimp cerviche, which the shrimp was too tough and the chips weren't that great; the eggplant cannelloni, which was too salty; and 3 skewers with a yummy sausage, a tasteless steak and an overcooked shrimp.  
Waiter was okay; the waterboy or the person that kept our drinks filled was very customer service oriented.
Will we be back?....No

I will start off by saying that I have an inherent bias because when I'm back in town I frequent Firefly often. I've lived in the Southern Highlands area for years and always noticed this restaurant and finally decided to dine here after checking out other Yelp reviews.

I can definitely say that I made a lucky choice to enter the establishment on a Monday - all you can eat tapas for $18.99?! Yes please! My hungry hippo self definitely salivated at that option and proceeded to order a variety of tapas to quell my monstrous appetite.

Tapas that I liked:
Pan fried dates 
Sautéed mushrooms 
Hamburger sliders
Chicken skewers
Mac and cheese with bacon
Beef carpaccio 
Pulled pork sliders
Vegetarian empanadas
House salad 
Barcelona fries 
Salami banderas
Tomato bruschetta

Tapas that I didn't care for:
Albondigas - I found this to be quite chewy and not very palatable
Ravioli - I am a ravioli fanatic, so part of why I didn't care for it is my high expectations for ravioli
Stuffed mushrooms - mushroom was good but the sauce was mediocre

Now if you're planning on doing the AYCE, just a forewarning that not all the tapas are available and the portions are even smaller. But you can order as much as you want so it's not that big of a deal. The AYCE was the perfect option for me because it came with a glass of sangria and a dessert. I ordered the cheesecake while my mother who accompanied me ordered the flan. Both were delicious!

The ambience of the restaurant is more casual than I expected walking into the establishment, but I enjoyed it none-the-less. It seems like a great place to have a casual dinner or hanging out with friends after work with some sangria, a few tapas, some sports playing on TV and some gaming. I can see myself frequenting this restaurant often when I come back to town.

Great food!  Great service!  Love the sangria!  Nice to have a local restaurant that has quality food and has a fun environment.  The all you can eat menu allows you to sample different dishes.  I haven't tried anything that I didn't like yet!  Our favorites are the tacos pastor, stuffed dates and the croquettas! So good! I highly recommend for you to stop by and give it a try!

I went with my friend on a weeknight and we had ayce tapas and I can say I really liked everything ,specially the calamari ,was the best I ever had so far.The waitress was very attentive and the chef,Edgar was very nice,came to see how we were doing.Now I know he is the owner .
I think a week later my boss ordered their paella for take out and it  was awesome!The price isunbelievable,just 24 dollars!I would definitely come back

I waited to write this review a couple days to determine if I would go 1 or 2 stars. First I will start with the good: (why I almost gave 2 stars) staff was attentive & bread was great. It stops there however...every item we ordered off of the tapas menu was awful. The sautéed calamari was extremely rubbery and tasted not night, sautéed spinach with garlic was edible but soaked & chewy, stuffed mushrooms with chorizo tasted ok but something off with the cheese, and lastly the filet mignion medallions were the worst tasting meat dish of my entire life...the meat was rubbery, tasted as if it had been frozen, thawed, and sat for days until it was almost bad. I had high hopes for a tapas restaurant in south Vegas...very disappointed. I would never return and I would not waste your time trying for yourself.

eh...came here for the restaurant.com coupon.   Service...eh....Food was a lot better than service.  It seems as if service is based on how the server judges you...i guess I looked like I couldn't afford much.  I don't know how to cook so all I do is eat out.  
example of service:

service:  how are you doing?

me:  the dish was...

and before I could answer, server was gone.  this must have happened 5+ times.  I can't even get a word out fast enough for the server to hear me.

I dunno...try the place and you decide. I know I wouldn't come back.

Barcelona Tapas Bar is in the Smith's business plaza right off of Decatur and Somerset Hills.  They have a very convenient website you can visit for their on-line menu:  www.barcelonatapas-bar.com.  They have booth seating, smaller tables by the bar, and separate bar seating.  We were greeted and seated very fast.  We were seated next to the bar.  The seating over there is a little cramped and the tables are shorter.  If you are tall or would like a little privacy I would recommend sitting in the normal sized booths away from the bar.  Our server was just friendly enough.  We may have caught him towards the end of his shift.  Our server was different after we had made our initial orders.  Our second server was extremely friendly and our drinks were always topped off.  We had gone on a Sunday which currently is 50% of all tapas.  They were packed but, the orders still came out pretty fast. We had ordered:

Chicken Empanadas
Pan Fried Dates
Stuffed Mushrooms
Calamares Fritos
Merguez Lamb Sausage
Croquetas

The dishes were standard tapas size.  I definitely recommend the Croquetas and the Pan Fried Dates!  The only thing I would say I wasn't a really big fan of was the stuffed Mushrooms.  The Croquetas were filled with Serrano ham, Manchengo cheese, and Parmesan cheese.  They were delicious.  And the Pan Fried Dates consist of pitted dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon with Merlot reduction and sprinkled with blue cheese.  You only get 5 of them so eat them slowly and enjoy.  I am going to give this place 3 out of 5 stars.  Our initial welcome felt a little off and I felt like the seating by the bar felt a little boot leg.  However, this place has awesome food and service when you get your food is so friendly!

Love Barcelona Tapas..everything that we ordered was delish!the ambiance of the restaurant is super nice and chill , you can enjoy a glass of sangria while watching the game or just listen to the Spanish guitar music background. We had the Fries, chicken piccata, yummy meatballs and bacon dates. But the bf's fav is the fries cause it's nicely done. The restaurant is by southern highlands which is the nice part of town so for the prices for their tapas plate is reasonable maybe a little bit more than firefly. Either way if you live in this side of town them this place is worth checking out
We live right up the block and come all the time. Surf and turf, pan fried dates, and sliders are my favorite. I haven't really tried anything I don't like.

Love this place! I have been coming here since they opened and will still be coming back cause everyone are friendly and so is the owner. He will go out of his way to come to your table and say hi!! :) food is great!!!!

A treasure was found! I love when  I am in a different neighborhood and find a restaurant that I enter into and I am taken to somewhere far far away like Barcelona.

The location is in a strip mall, enter through the door and you are taken to Barcelona. I love the low lights,dark wood floors and tables with the Spanish flags and decor. When I saw tapas in the window I was immediately sold. They have an all you can eat menu and trust me when I return I will be in for that menu!

I stopped by to get something light to eat and a tea, and was I sorry I had already eaten lunch and have dinner reservations later. I tried the croquettes and I was in heaven. They were perfectly crispy and the warmed mashed potatoes with cheese, ham and chorizo were heavenly. I will return and will write more, for now, this is a must when you are in the  area.

I loved everything, and this last note is not a reflection of the restaurant, but a patron who brought in a child, gave them an iPad to watch a Disney movie, and it was so loud it ruined my experience. Please, please, don't do this people! Bring headphones if your child needs to be entertained. 

My Check in.... um how do I delete an error?????

Good food I live down the st from here and I take my kids about once a month everything is good.. only bad thing is the soft drinks are some times really flat other then that it's great for happy hour all you can eat for $20 a person on Monday
Me and my hubby have been here a few times and we haven't been disappointed.  The steamed clams are my favorite!  Remember to order extra bread in order to soak up the sauce.  It's to die for!

Returning from Spain only five months ago, we were craving tapas.  There aren't that many options for tapas in Las Vegas beyond the two Firefly locations.

Barcelona Tapas and Bar gives us one other place to consider when you're craving small bites.

Located in a busy strip mall where locals frequent, this restaurant had a few customers by the bar and dining when we walked in on a weekday night.

I had a few things in mind immediately based on previous yelpers, so we got to ordering.  We munched on complimentary bread and spreads while we waited for our orders to arrive.

* Beef Carpaccio "Thin sliced of tender tails drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette, truffle oil, tapenade, and fried onions" ($8) - I love beef carpaccio...when it's done right.  Yelpers raved about their version and sadly, we couldn't quite see why.  It's more like cured beef than raw beef, which is what we were expecting.  Not quite like beef jerky, but not delicate like what we're familiar with.  It was also covered with large shavings of cheese, which was not mentioned.   Not sure if this was to cover up the beef or enhance the taste.

* Pastelillos de pollo (Chicken Cakes) "Chopped chicken, green and red onions, red pepper, chopped cilantro, black bean and corn salsa molded together and grilled served with gribiche." ($5.50) - Something a bit unusual that you don't see on every menu.  It's a bit misleading in its description since we were expecting all the ingredients to be 'molded together' to create a corn cake.  In actuality, the black bean and corn salsa are on the side of the corn cake.  Nonetheless, it was quite tasty with the accompanying egg sauce.  And it is only one corn cake.

* Merguez Lamb Sausage "Served with couscous, and roasted pepper tomato sauce and a Merlot wine reduction sauce." ($7.50) - There was a distinctive lamb taste to it, and what I'm sure was some liver blended into the mixture.  The Husband isn't a fan of most livers so he was very aware of the funny taste to it.  Comes two in an order.

* Pan Fried Dates "Pitted dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon with merlot reduction and sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles." ($5.50) - Anything wrapped in bacon usually can't go wrong, and dates mix perfectly with bacon in this case too.  Comes five in an order.

* Boquerones (White Anchovies) "Toasted French bread with a spicy aioli topped with sweet white anchovies and balsamic reduction sauce." ($5.50) - Anchovies were something we enjoyed everyday when we were in Spain, but we didn't know what took so long for this one order to come out.  The bread could have been toasted just a bit longer.  

* Lomo a la parrilla (Petite Filet) "Mashed potato, mushroom and Merlot sauce." ($8.50) - Our final order, which we put in at the last minute.  It took a bit too long, and the waiter did come by to say it was coming out soon.  (It still took longer after that.  I can only assume that our order got stuck behind the larger parties that had come in after us.)  Another one of those dishes I ordered based on raving reviews, and sadly, it did disappoint.  We ordered it rare and although the center was pink, the outside was grilled a bit too long and thus hard.  

We were impressed by how busy it got for a weekday night - and Barcelona Tapas & Bar does cater to families with plenty of large tables, high chairs, and a diaper changing station in the restroom.  Right now they are offering an introductory and temporary offer where kids eat free on Sundays through Tuesdays from 4 pm to 8 pm, for those 10 and under only and with a purchase of an adult entree.

Service was okay - we asked our waitress for another set of silverware and she completely forgot about it.  (Immediately after we asked her, she went to sit a  party that arrived and never came back.)  We also had to ask for our beverages to be refilled.  The man who sat us did ask us how we had heard about them.  We also noticed the chef come by our table four different times to look at what we were eating, but never actually said anything to us.  

Specials include:
Mondays: Half off bottles of wine.
Tuesdays: Half off their homemade Sangria.
Wednesdays: Half off Martinis.
Thursdays: Half off Mojitos.
Fridays: Half off all their tapas from 4 pm to 6 pm
Saturdays: Ladies Night with Half off all House drinks, wines and beer from 10 pm to 12 am.  Live music.
Karaoke everyday (except Fridays and Saturdays) and tapas are half off after 10 pm.

According to their website, they are open for lunch now - but their opening hours are still posted as opening at 4 pm.

There are coupons everywhere for them - restaurant.com, local newspaper, and online.
Food was excellent and fast lots of great choices Service was very friendly and on top of things

I had a http://restaurants.com gift card for this place so it seemed like a great time to try it for the first time. 

First of all they completely "attempted" to copy Firefly without success!

The service was horrible. I'm pretty sure there was only one waitress for the entire place. It was 2pm on a Tuesday when we visited so it wasn't really busy but with 5 tables they needed more help. The waitress became frustrated with our requests for water refills and just brought us a pitcher which was fine with us. 

Spicy shrimp was my favorite dish with great sauce.
Bacon wrapped dates were super salty. 
The mac and cheese was really dry and lacking cheesiness.
The fries were cold so we sent them back.

I don't for-see another visit to Barcelona's even with a gift card!
Good service and good food! Sangria was delicious too. Nice vibe and you can watch sports there as well.

We originally intended to try out the breakfast place a few doors down but didn't want to wait 30+ minutes to get a seat. (We wanted to get on the road somewhat quickly to avoid the Sunday traffic back to California). Anyways, long story short, I'm so glad we chose this place! The all you can eat brunch tapas were so delicious. Each dish that came out was freshly prepared and did not disappoint. The Banana Foster pancakes were amazing, as were the dates and fried goat cheese. The all you can eat brunch was a little more expensive at 20 dollars a person, but it included a mimosa/bloody mary of your choice and the food was really worth it. What a great ending to our Vegas weekend!
Went here for my birthday and had such an amazing start to my day, thanks to the staff! Great food, and great people!

When you're a woman of "buffet style eating"...you're attracted to food joints that specialize in tapas because then you get to indulge in what you love.....a lot for a little!! 

Because this place has a 4 star rating, seems only fitting for me to cruise on in, after all, I'm sold on all of the yelpers food photos! Looks delish!!

To be rather blunt, it was neither good nor bad! Didn't blow my stomach's mind or any of that goodness. 

I came in for Happy hour and ordered everything from the HH menu so i can try a lot for a little. I was enticed by all of the pictures on yelp and it just so happened that everything that drew me in was conveniently on the HH menu! (Yay) 

I was surprised to say that not one thing gave me that "wow" factor! Not one thing imprinted my heart enough to compel me to want to return! Everything, when it comes to the HH menu, was simply bland and unsatisfying. Disappointed! 


Service was quick and great!!! Food came out soo fast, kind of makes me wonder how it's prepared in the back! Not complaining at all, I'm a woman of instant gratification when it comes to eating out, so fast food doesn't bug me! 

All in all, very bland food!! If you're a simple, non picky eater, you will enjoy this. But if you're a person of explosive flavor and enjoy creative culinary spice full foods, this isn't the place for you!

After reading the other reviews on yelp, I was a little skeptical of trying this place, only because people mention bad service, and that's my biggest pet peeve. But after passing it a few times, Yelp reviewers couldn't stop me, and I decided I had to make up my own mind. 

So, my man and I came here on a Thursday date night, and had a WONDERFUL time!! Got here around 6ish, and were seated right away. The server was friendly and gave us lots of tips on the most popular items. Everything is like 3 bites, so we decided to go big and order a bunch of things.

Beef Carpacio - DELICIOUS! Great flavor!
Boquerones - My man is spanish and loves anchovies. I was VERY hesitant to try this, but it was AMAZING. He didn't like the balsamic drizzle, but I did... not "fishy" at all and one of the best dishes
Tortilla Espanola - It was just alright. Being from Spain, I think my man judges a little harshly, but I've had better than this too. It didn't stop us from eating all of it though :)
Steamed Mussels - So good. The broth was amazing, and so flavorful. We ate all of this in a hurry.
Garlic Shrimp - Just what you would expect. Really good. Lots of garlic in a good way.
Croquetas - There was supposed to be serrano ham in here, but we couldn't really taste it. Nonetheless, it was really good. Crispy outside, and really cheesy/potatoey goodness on the inside.

After ordering all of this, and devouring it cause it was amazing, our server sent out a complimentary chicken cake :) 

Oh, and it was national chocolate cake day, so I decided to get to Chocolate Tres Leches, and it was rich and sweet, and just what I needed to end dinner with. My man got the flan, and it was also really good!! 

When we got ready to leave, the place had really filled up. And I noticed they only had 1 server and 1 helper for the whole place! So since we got there before the rush, our server had time to serve us properly, but now that he had 10+ tables, I can see where the bad reviews came from. I suggest that the management get another server cause the food is great!!

We will definitely be back. To top it off, they have a coupon on their website! You should definitely utilize this, cause our bill was only $50+tip after it was all said and done! Total score!

The food was okay. My favorite part of the meal was the dessert- bananas foster crepe. The banana slices were sweet but the ice cream inside the crepe melted too fast because the dish is served warm.  I would go back and try some of the other cold tapas.

Have been here twice and each time for happy hour. They have great happy hour entrees with really great food and the sangria is fabulous. You can order separate items or all you can eat which I have never done. Had very great service each time. Also it's nice you can have happy hour at a regular table instead of just the bar. I am planning to return soon. They have some sort of special each day.

It's an ok place, variety of food it's not as extensive and flavorful as Firefly. Service isn't that great either, the waitresses seem to be annoyed every time they came to my table. The portions are pathetic. Additionally, this place is so pathetic that they can't even have their own tables. They operate with tables from a restaurant called; "Hurricane Grill & Wings" which is located in Wichita, KS. I believe there's another one in So Cal. Sorry, no competition with firefly.
Best tapas and paella I have had at a very reasonable price! Very attentive customer service! I will definitely come here when craving for tapas!

Been meaning to try this place and so glad we finally did! We were seated and greeted right when we walked in. Everyone was very nice, fast and attentive. Our drinks were never left empty and our dirty plates were always gone right away. Brianna our server was such a sweetheart and her recommendations were amazing. We loved everything she recommended and we would definitely come back just to see her to enjoy the good company while we enjoy our food.

Food was on point! We literally tried everything on the $25.95 AYCE menu except for like 2 items. Almost everything came out bite sized so it was perfect bc we got to try everything to see what we really like and what we thought was just ok. Mostly everything was seasoned perfectly with extra flavor and yes some may have needed a little bit of salt but it was all really good. Nothing we didn't like which was a good sign. 

Some of our favorites were the bacon wrapped dates, salami, beef carpaccio, artichokes, and of course the red sangria which we order multiples of each. With the AYCE it comes with Red or White Sangria and dessert. For dessert we had the bread pudding that comes with dried cherries and ice cream and the chocolate coconut tres Leches with were both so delicious. Yes I was stuffed but I managed to finish both of those haha always room for desserts  

They have daily specials so always check to see what you may like. I will definitely be back on Mondays for their $18.99 AYCE Tapas Special  Next time we will also eat from the A La Carte menu because their paella is calling my name

Sometimes, all you want in life is sangria. For me, this was a craving that spanned the course of three weeks. So when a friend wanted to meet up for dinner, I knew that Barcelona's happy hour was a must.

From the hours of 4 to 7, happy hour is a must do. Check in on Yelp for a free glass of sangria - sweet, strong, and in quantities more than a single glass, potentially dangerous. My friend and I ordered a mass array of goodies from the happy hour menu. The vegetable empanadas ($2.75) were little fried pockets of all sorts of vegetables - pretty good but nothing fantastic. Croquetas ($2.75) were also good, only made better with the aioli on the side. Lastly, the eggplant cannelloni ($3.50) was perfectly balanced with the hearty eggplant and the tang of tomato sauce. 

While dessert was the last thing on my mind, we somehow got conned into ordering...wait for it, Fried Chocolate Tres Leches a la Mode (I take liberties with the word 'conned'). Sometimes you don't realize you're having a bad week until you take a bite into something so sinfully delicious. One bite of this Tres Leches and suddenly, life is better. 

The food is good, and the happy hour deals amazing. But the real keeper here is Edgar, the owner. He's so warm and hospitable. But be warned, warmness goes right out the door when it comes to dessert. He'll charm you into ordering things you'd never eat normally thanks to diet and a conscience. In all earnestness, he has something good going on here, and I'm happy to see this place doing well.

This is the second time I have come here for a birthday dinner, the first time was a bit of a bump in the road but this time it was perfect. It was a large group so we just ordered all you can eat as a table and got everything "family style" so they would bring a couple portions out at a time. The drinks are delicious, I had the jalapeño and cucumber margarita which I would give 5 stars by itself. The Mac n cheese is a MUST ORDER!!!!

Great food and tasty sangria! The service is great. The all you can eat tapas is good if you want to try several dishes. I can honestly say that we haven't had one dish that we didn't  like. I recommend trying Barcelona Tapas.
Convenient restaurant in Southern Highlands. We tried several things and they were all good. The salami skewers were yummy, and so were the stuffed mini peppers.

We have been here twice and I like it. The prices are decent for what you get. I've been slightly disappointed in a couple of the small plates we have tried. I LOVE the fruit and cheese platter. My daughter (10) even likes eating here, which is surprising for such eclectic fare. I think I will stop by during happy hour next.

Happy Hour -
All days after 10pm
Friday 4-6
1/2 of all Tapas.
They have several other specials, each day of the week (half off mojoitos, sangria, etc).  Go to their website, it will describe them all.

Everything I had here was delicious.  I had the petite filet, chicken cake, potatoes, dates, manchego cheese w/ serrano hame.  I'll definitely be going back!
This place was recommended to us so we tried. Food was very good, service was responsive and a price confusion was handled professionally!

The atmosphere was very comfortable and the food was delicious. I went in for a quick lunch, but I realized that others had the same idea! One server and the owner out on the floor hence my reason for 4 stars. Both exceptionally friendly and hard-working but maybe one more server would have been nice. Nonetheless, the food was fabulous and the spicy butter for the bread was ridiculous! So much flavor! Will return for sure, with more time to spare and a designated driver for those mojitos and sangria.

Great happy hour value! So glad that we have a place like this close to home. 

Been here several times and it's never been super busy. I like the food and the red sangria is great. 

In the busy Southern Highlands Smith's shopping center. 

I have always had friendly and fast service every time I come here.
Always wonderful. We come in for their happy hour specials at least once a month. Sometimes they can get a little backed up, they're still kind and we still have a great time.

I have driven by Barcelona so many times but finally stopped in for lunch today for the first time. I'm sorry I didn't try it sooner. The food was all great and the service was great as well. The beef carpachio and calamari were some of my favorites, along with the beef empanadas. Everyone was very friendly and extremely attentive.

I can't wait to go back again!

I love this place!  Amazing tapas!  Some of my favorites... Fried goat cheese...  Sautéed calamari with capers.... Spicy shrimp and of course... Tacos!  Must visit!  Great specials nightly and also all you can eat lunch or dinner specials!

Tried the food here yesterday since I live close by. The food is good but it tastes too much like home-cooked food for me. Barcelona lacks the sophistication at similar places like Firefly. However, if you are not picky, this place is a good tapas option for the area.
This place was amazing tapas came in - portions go from 4-6 for happy hour. They have 3.00 sangria  go get  yourself some

There's something about Tapas... I can't get over it. 

I decided to give my fave Firefly a break and give Barcelona a try. I came in with low expectations thinking that nothing could ever come close to Firefly's amazing-ness... haha but I was wrong! This place did not disappoint at all. There was no wait, the waiters were extremely friendly, and the food was delicious. 

When we went, it was pretty quiet, laid back...not really any music playing or any large crowds getting their drank on haha.. Seems like a good Tapas bar for a spot to have an intimate date or small get together to catch up with your friends... 

There was some signs for half off ALL TAPAS on Sundays and Mondays from 8-10pm (such a BOMBBB deal)... and different types of drink/food deals every night. I don't really remember what they were exactly, but if you're a local DEFINITELY check it out! 

I'm sure this place can get crazyyy so I'm lookin forward to coming back during their speciallssssssssss. 

Recommendations: 
Shrimp a la Diabla- if you're into spicy, tangy sauce 
Bruschetta- different from the usual Italian basil flavored bruschetta... lots of olives, feta, tomato 
Surf and Turf- Skewer combo with steak, shrimp in a green sauce, and chorizo... comes with yummy mashed potatoes 

Go to their website for a coupon for 10% off! 
http://www.citycoups.com/barcelonatapasbarcoupon.html

The interior ambience is awesome. I visited around 3pm on a weekday .. an hour too early for Happy Hour .. which is a good option if you're checking it out as the prices are better. I ordered 3 items .. carpaccio .. mussels .. croqueta .. and the "house" pinot noir .. I love tapas and was excited to try Barcelona unfortunately I left really disappointed. Not one of the items was tasty .. the carpaccio was cleary prepped (who knows when) as it needed to be peeled from the plate due to refrigeration moisture .. capers would be a great addition. The mussels were awful and the croquetas were just ok. The best part of this experience was a really wonderful waiter! Regretfully I wouldn't return.

Second trip here. I never review after one visit in order to make sure that I didn't catch them on a bad night (or a good one). 

My family and I love the food. The Camerones a la Diabla were the only downfall as the shrimp had no real taste beyond the sauce. Across the board we have tried about a third of the menu without a problem except for the shrimp.

Service on the other hand needs major improvement. Our waiter seems preoccupied and has no patience. (Same waiter both visits) There are four of us and when taking our drink order he left after getting two drinks as my wife and daughter hesitated while ordering. 

I'd like to make this a regular dining location but service matters to us. So overall a 3.

I have never been disappointed by this restaurant and always have great food and service. The pan fried dates are my favorite and the fried goat cheese is awesome. We tried their brunch today and again, we were not disappointed. The French toast was great, it wasn't to heavy and overly sweet like some places, and the breakfast potatoes were delicious. We ordered the steak but the owner explained that he couldn't get the quality of steaks he wanted so he didn't get them. We got the ham instead and that was fine with us.

Ive been coming to Barcelona Tapas & Bar since it opened(before they got their liquor licence). I'm glad i stumbled upon this little gem. I always get either the beef carpaccio or the tuna to start then i move my way up to the fillet Mignon MMMmmMMM and of course the capers MMMmMM their sangria is BOMB! They have all types of specials depending on the day of the week. I am def a regular here!

As a fan of Rise & Shine (it's a few doors down) I decided to check Barcelona out during their 7 day happy hour. We really enjoyed it. It wasn't too crowded. The service was just right and the food was quite yummy.

The goat cheese was awesome, the queso fundido was so yummy. And we really liked the empanadas.

I am a huge fan of firefly so I was really excited to find a place that was just as good and maybe even better.

I went here because of the Groupon deal and thought it would be a nice restaurant. The restaurant is very far from me in southern Highlands so just the drive alone doesn't make it worth it. The food was okay nothing special we had the Barcelona fries which where pretty good, then we had the fried calamari which was really greasy and soggy. Next we had the barbecue ribs which were probably the best thing that we had.  last we had the fish tacos which had absolutely no flavor at on!  I give it 3 stars because Our waiter  was pretty nice and offered us a free desert b/c I didn't like the fish tacos.  I would not go back there again

What a happy hour! It goes from 4-7 everyday and the tapas are half off with the exception of shrimp dishes and desserts. Even with those limitations, there are plenty to choose from. 

If you are the type of person that can make a meal out of appetizers, then tapas are perfect for you. Sometimes called the Spanish dim sum, these dishes are the perfect size to try a few. I am not the type of person that goes to a happy hour to save money, instead I order twice what I normally would and have it even out in the end.

The fantastic dishes: 
Chilled orzo salad- The orzo was cooked al dente with a nice bite and the grilled veggies were very flavorful. 
Beef carpaccio- This was a generous portion of thinly sliced raw beef. The parm, fried onion strings, balsamic vinaigrette, and tapanade mingled well. Place on on the bread and you have a good contrast in textures.
Stuffed peppers- The creaminess of the three cheese blend with a corn and black bean salad was mellow compared to the other strong tastes.
Bananas foster crepe- The crepe was more crisp than normal, but was perfect with the softness of the caramelized bananas and ice cream.

The good:
Stuffed dates wrapped in bacon. These were pretty standard.
Fried goat cheese- The balsamic vinegar and honey that line the dish made it delicious, but very decadent.
Summer bean salad- good but took the dressing from the goat cheese to make it better.
Strawberries tossed in a balsamic vinegar and cream with a sugar crust. Was decent, the balsamic did not play a prominent part in the dish.

The bad:
Tuna tartar- I love raw tuna in any form, but my friend said it all when she said it looked like cat food. It was bland on top of looking less than appetizing. 
Fried tres leches a la mode- Tasted and had the texture of fried chicken. Not the most appealing of the desserts.

The desserts are not part of the tapas deal for happy hour. The only one I would pay full price for is the bananas foster crepe. Our eyes were bigger than stomaches and it almost doubled our bill. Still for everything we got, it was a great deal.

I've been wanting to try Barcelona for a long time, we finally got a group together and made our way there. Staff was friendly and efficient even with our large group. The restaurant is small and intimate.
We missed happy hour:( But we had a 20% off coupon from a mailer. 
Started with a Blood Orange martini...it was delicious, while looking over the menu we were brought complementary toast with hummus and a sweet butter spread.
We decided to share steak skewers, mac and cheese, and ham and cheese croquets. The steak was yummy, well seasoned and done medium as we had asked a small scoop of mashed potatoes was included, they were a little runny and needed salt but edible with the steak, the mac and cheese was lacking bacon which the menu says is blended in side, we didn't see or taste any bacon. The ham and cheese croquets looked good and weren't greasy but were flavorless, again I added salt. My friend had a few different items than we did and agreed the food needed more seasoning. Everyone raved about the bacon wrapped dates.
We skipped dessert because our friend had brought along cake to celebrate her husbands birthday.
I'm glad I got to go and take this restaurant off my list of places to try, I doubt I'll go back, I'd rather go to Firefly for tapas (5 stars).

Came here awhile back and haven't gotten around to writing a review till now. I was NOT a fan. Moment i walked in I stood there for awhile feeling like an idiot cause no one greeted me or showed me where to sit. My boyfriend and I eventually just picked a spot and waited for a server to flag down. Eventually an older gentleman with an accent came up to us and gave us menus. I ordered a pitcher of white sangria. It wasn't bad but it wasn't very good either. To be honest, the food was completely un-memorable that I forgot everything we had ordered. I just remember being excited for the bacon wrapped dates because I love them over at Firefly. Well it was not like Firefly's dates. They were soggy and incredibly salty. The server also never came back again and when he eventually did come around to give us our check, it looked like he was in the middle of eating something. I quickly paid and got the hell out of there. I haven't been back since and I probably never will. If they fixed their customer service and cleaned up their dishes a bit, they could probably do well. I guess I'll never know.

I have eaten at this restaurants numerous times. More so when they first opened, I believe it was around 2009. At first I really liked it. My husband and I used to go at least once a week! We loved the bartender, Melissa who I might add is no longer with them. I feel that I never reviewed this place for that reason, because we just really enjoyed her service, even after numerous bad meals there. 
 I've had meals there that were hit or miss. The food is extremely inconsistent. You have a dish you love, like their Tilapia, for instance was great the last few times I ate there the sauce was different, and the tilapia was so way overlooked. The last straw for my husband was when on Fathers Day last year they had a prime rib or ribeye special, can't remember which. My husband asked the weight, again don't remember if they said 12 or 16 ounces. It was so shady and sneaky, it couldn't be more than 4 and a half ounces!
